text: "Christmas won't be Christmas without any presents," grumbled Jo, lying
title: Little Women

text: on the rug.
title: Little Women

text: "It's so dreadful to be poor!" sighed Meg, looking down at her old
title: Little Women

text: dress.
title: Little Women

text: "I don't think it's fair for some girls to have plenty of pretty
title: Little Women

text: things, and other girls nothing at all," added little Amy, with an
title: Little Women

text: injured sniff.
title: Little Women

text: "We've got Father and Mother, and each other," said Beth contentedly
title: Little Women

text: from her corner.
title: Little Women

text: The four young faces on which the firelight shone brightened at the
title: Little Women

text: cheerful words, but darkened again as Jo said sadly, "We haven't got
title: Little Women

text: Father, and shall not have him for a long time." She didn't say
title: Little Women

text: "perhaps never," but each silently added it, thinking of Father far
title: Little Women

text: away, where the fighting was.
title: Little Women

text: Nobody spoke for a minute; then Meg said in an altered tone, "You know
title: Little Women

text: the reason Mother proposed not having any presents this Christmas was
title: Little Women

text: because it is going to be a hard winter for everyone; and she thinks we
title: Little Women

text: ought not to spend money for pleasure, when our men are suffering so in
title: Little Women

text: the army.  We can't do much, but we can make our little sacrifices, and
title: Little Women

text: ought to do it gladly.  But I am afraid I don't," and Meg shook her
title: Little Women

text: head, as she thought regretfully of all the pretty things she wanted.
title: Little Women

text: "But I don't think the little we should spend would do any good.  We've
title: Little Women

text: each got a dollar, and the army wouldn't be much helped by our giving
title: Little Women

text: that.  I agree not to expect anything from Mother or you, but I do want
title: Little Women

text: to buy _Undine and Sintran_ for myself.  I've wanted it so long," said
title: Little Women

text: Jo, who was a bookworm.
title: Little Women

text: "I planned to spend mine in new music," said Beth, with a little sigh,
title: Little Women

text: which no one heard but the hearth brush and kettle-holder.
title: Little Women

text: "I shall get a nice box of Faber's drawing pencils; I really need
title: Little Women

text: them," said Amy decidedly.
title: Little Women

text: "Mother didn't say anything about our money, and she won't wish us to
title: Little Women

text: give up everything.  Let's each buy what we want, and have a little
title: Little Women

text: fun; I'm sure we work hard enough to earn it," cried Jo, examining the
title: Little Women

text: heels of her shoes in a gentlemanly manner.
title: Little Women

text: "I know I do--teaching those tiresome children nearly all day, when I'm
title: Little Women

text: longing to enjoy myself at home," began Meg, in the complaining tone
title: Little Women

text: again.
title: Little Women

text: "You don't have half such a hard time as I do," said Jo. "How would you
title: Little Women

text: like to be shut up for hours with a nervous, fussy old lady, who keeps
title: Little Women

text: you trotting, is never satisfied, and worries you till you're ready to
title: Little Women

text: fly out the window or cry?"
title: Little Women

text: "It's naughty to fret, but I do think washing dishes and keeping things
title: Little Women

text: tidy is the worst work in the world.  It makes me cross, and my hands
title: Little Women

text: get so stiff, I can't practice well at all." And Beth looked at her
title: Little Women

text: rough hands with a sigh that any one could hear that time.
title: Little Women

text: "I don't believe any of you suffer as I do," cried Amy, "for you don't
title: Little Women

text: have to go to school with impertinent girls, who plague you if you
title: Little Women

text: don't know your lessons, and laugh at your dresses, and label your
title: Little Women

text: father if he isn't rich, and insult you when your nose isn't nice."
title: Little Women

text: "If you mean libel, I'd say so, and not talk about labels, as if Papa
title: Little Women

text: was a pickle bottle," advised Jo, laughing.
title: Little Women

text: "I know what I mean, and you needn't be statirical about it. It's
title: Little Women

text: proper to use good words, and improve your vocabilary," returned Amy,
title: Little Women

text: with dignity.
title: Little Women

text: "Don't peck at one another, children.  Don't you wish we had the money
title: Little Women

text: Papa lost when we were little, Jo?  Dear me! How happy and good we'd
title: Little Women

text: be, if we had no worries!" said Meg, who could remember better times.
title: Little Women

text: "You said the other day you thought we were a deal happier than the
title: Little Women

text: King children, for they were fighting and fretting all the time, in
title: Little Women

text: spite of their money."
title: Little Women

text: "So I did, Beth.  Well, I think we are.  For though we do have to work,
title: Little Women

text: we make fun of ourselves, and are a pretty jolly set, as Jo would say."
title: Little Women

text: "Jo does use such slang words!" observed Amy, with a reproving look at
title: Little Women

text: the long figure stretched on the rug.
title: Little Women

text: Jo immediately sat up, put her hands in her pockets, and began to
title: Little Women

text: whistle.
title: Little Women

text: "Don't, Jo.  It's so boyish!"
title: Little Women

text: "That's why I do it."
title: Little Women

text: "I detest rude, unladylike girls!"
title: Little Women

text: "I hate affected, niminy-piminy chits!"
title: Little Women

text: "Birds in their little nests agree," sang Beth, the peacemaker, with
title: Little Women

text: such a funny face that both sharp voices softened to a laugh, and the
title: Little Women

text: "pecking" ended for that time.
title: Little Women

text: "Really, girls, you are both to be blamed," said Meg, beginning to
title: Little Women

text: lecture in her elder-sisterly fashion. "You are old enough to leave off
title: Little Women

text: boyish tricks, and to behave better, Josephine.  It didn't matter so
title: Little Women

text: much when you were a little girl, but now you are so tall, and turn up
title: Little Women

text: your hair, you should remember that you are a young lady."
title: Little Women

text: "I'm not!   And if turning up my hair makes me one, I'll wear it in two
title: Little Women

text: tails till I'm twenty," cried Jo, pulling off her net, and shaking down
title: Little Women

text: a chestnut mane.  "I hate to think I've got to grow up, and be Miss
title: Little Women

text: March, and wear long gowns, and look as prim as a China Aster!  It's
title: Little Women

text: bad enough to be a girl, anyway, when I like boy's games and work and
title: Little Women

text: manners!  I can't get over my disappointment in not being a boy.  And
title: Little Women

text: it's worse than ever now, for I'm dying to go and fight with Papa. And
title: Little Women

text: I can only stay home and knit, like a poky old woman!"
title: Little Women

text: And Jo shook the blue army sock till the needles rattled like
title: Little Women

text: castanets, and her ball bounded across the room.
title: Little Women

text: "Poor Jo!  It's too bad, but it can't be helped.  So you must try to be
title: Little Women

text: contented with making your name boyish, and playing brother to us
title: Little Women

text: girls," said Beth, stroking the rough head with a hand that all the
title: Little Women

text: dish washing and dusting in the world could not make ungentle in its
title: Little Women

text: touch.
title: Little Women

text: "As for you, Amy," continued Meg, "you are altogether too particular
title: Little Women

text: and prim.  Your airs are funny now, but you'll grow up an affected
title: Little Women

text: little goose, if you don't take care. I like your nice manners and
title: Little Women

text: refined ways of speaking, when you don't try to be elegant.  But your
title: Little Women

text: absurd words are as bad as Jo's slang."
title: Little Women

text: "If Jo is a tomboy and Amy a goose, what am I, please?" asked Beth,
title: Little Women

text: ready to share the lecture.
title: Little Women

text: "You're a dear, and nothing else," answered Meg warmly, and no one
title: Little Women

text: contradicted her, for the 'Mouse' was the pet of the family.
title: Little Women

text: As young readers like to know 'how people look', we will take this
title: Little Women

text: moment to give them a little sketch of the four sisters, who sat
title: Little Women

text: knitting away in the twilight, while the December snow fell quietly
title: Little Women

text: without, and the fire crackled cheerfully within.  It was a comfortable
title: Little Women

text: room, though the carpet was faded and the furniture very plain, for a
title: Little Women

text: good picture or two hung on the walls, books filled the recesses,
title: Little Women

text: chrysanthemums and Christmas roses bloomed in the windows, and a
title: Little Women

text: pleasant atmosphere of home peace pervaded it.
title: Little Women

text: Margaret, the eldest of the four, was sixteen, and very pretty, being
title: Little Women

text: plump and fair, with large eyes, plenty of soft brown hair, a sweet
title: Little Women

text: mouth, and white hands, of which she was rather vain. Fifteen-year-old
title: Little Women

text: Jo was very tall, thin, and brown, and reminded one of a colt, for she
title: Little Women

text: never seemed to know what to do with her long limbs, which were very
title: Little Women

text: much in her way.  She had a decided mouth, a comical nose, and sharp,
title: Little Women

text: gray eyes, which appeared to see everything, and were by turns fierce,
title: Little Women

text: funny, or thoughtful.  Her long, thick hair was her one beauty, but it
title: Little Women

text: was usually bundled into a net, to be out of her way.  Round shoulders
title: Little Women

text: had Jo, big hands and feet, a flyaway look to her clothes, and the
title: Little Women

text: uncomfortable appearance of a girl who was rapidly shooting up into a
title: Little Women

text: woman and didn't like it. Elizabeth, or Beth, as everyone called her,
title: Little Women

text: was a rosy, smooth-haired, bright-eyed girl of thirteen, with a shy
title: Little Women

text: manner, a timid voice, and a peaceful expression which was seldom
title: Little Women

text: disturbed.  Her father called her 'Little Miss Tranquility', and the
title: Little Women

text: name suited her excellently, for she seemed to live in a happy world of
title: Little Women

text: her own, only venturing out to meet the few whom she trusted and loved.
title: Little Women

text: Amy, though the youngest, was a most important person, in her own
title: Little Women

text: opinion at least.  A regular snow maiden, with blue eyes, and yellow
title: Little Women

text: hair curling on her shoulders, pale and slender, and always carrying
title: Little Women

text: herself like a young lady mindful of her manners.  What the characters
title: Little Women

text: of the four sisters were we will leave to be found out.
title: Little Women

text: The clock struck six and, having swept up the hearth, Beth put a pair
title: Little Women

text: of slippers down to warm.  Somehow the sight of the old shoes had a
title: Little Women

text: good effect upon the girls, for Mother was coming, and everyone
title: Little Women

text: brightened to welcome her.  Meg stopped lecturing, and lighted the
title: Little Women

text: lamp, Amy got out of the easy chair without being asked, and Jo forgot
title: Little Women

text: how tired she was as she sat up to hold the slippers nearer to the
title: Little Women

text: blaze.
title: Little Women

text: "They are quite worn out.  Marmee must have a new pair."
title: Little Women

text: "I thought I'd get her some with my dollar," said Beth.
title: Little Women

text: "No, I shall!" cried Amy.
title: Little Women

text: "I'm the oldest," began Meg, but Jo cut in with a decided, "I'm the man
title: Little Women

text: of the family now Papa is away, and I shall provide the slippers, for
title: Little Women

text: he told me to take special care of Mother while he was gone."
title: Little Women

text: "I'll tell you what we'll do," said Beth, "let's each get her something
title: Little Women

text: for Christmas, and not get anything for ourselves."
title: Little Women

text: "That's like you, dear!  What will we get?" exclaimed Jo.
title: Little Women

text: Everyone thought soberly for a minute, then Meg announced, as if the
title: Little Women

text: idea was suggested by the sight of her own pretty hands, "I shall give
title: Little Women

text: her a nice pair of gloves."
title: Little Women

text: "Army shoes, best to be had," cried Jo.
title: Little Women

text: "Some handkerchiefs, all hemmed," said Beth.
title: Little Women

text: "I'll get a little bottle of cologne.  She likes it, and it won't cost
title: Little Women

text: much, so I'll have some left to buy my pencils," added Amy.
title: Little Women

text: "How will we give the things?" asked Meg.
title: Little Women

text: "Put them on the table, and bring her in and see her open the bundles.
title: Little Women

text: Don't you remember how we used to do on our birthdays?" answered Jo.
title: Little Women

text: "I used to be so frightened when it was my turn to sit in the chair
title: Little Women

text: with the crown on, and see you all come marching round to give the
title: Little Women

text: presents, with a kiss.  I liked the things and the kisses, but it was
title: Little Women

text: dreadful to have you sit looking at me while I opened the bundles,"
title: Little Women

text: said Beth, who was toasting her face and the bread for tea at the same
title: Little Women

text: time.
title: Little Women

text: "Let Marmee think we are getting things for ourselves, and then
title: Little Women

text: surprise her.  We must go shopping tomorrow afternoon, Meg. There is so
title: Little Women

text: much to do about the play for Christmas night," said Jo, marching up
title: Little Women

text: and down, with her hands behind her back, and her nose in the air.
title: Little Women

text: "I don't mean to act any more after this time.  I'm getting too old for
title: Little Women

text: such things," observed Meg, who was as much a child as ever about
title: Little Women

text: 'dressing-up' frolics.
title: Little Women

text: "You won't stop, I know, as long as you can trail round in a white gown
title: Little Women

text: with your hair down, and wear gold-paper jewelry. You are the best
title: Little Women

text: actress we've got, and there'll be an end of everything if you quit the
title: Little Women

text: boards," said Jo.  "We ought to rehearse tonight.  Come here, Amy, and
title: Little Women

text: do the fainting scene, for you are as stiff as a poker in that."
title: Little Women

text: "I can't help it.  I never saw anyone faint, and I don't choose to make
title: Little Women

text: myself all black and blue, tumbling flat as you do.  If I can go down
title: Little Women

text: easily, I'll drop.  If I can't, I shall fall into a chair and be

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: of the piece.
title: Little Women

text: "Do it this way.  Clasp your hands so, and stagger across the room,
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: her bread burn as she watched the fun with interest. "It's no use!  Do
title: Little Women

text: the best you can when the time comes, and if the audience laughs, don't
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: "It's the best we've had yet," said Meg, as the dead villain sat up and
title: Little Women

text: rubbed his elbows.

text: "I don't see how you can write and act such splendid things, Jo.

title: Little Women

text: her sisters were gifted with wonderful genius in all things.

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: bread.  Beth's stage-struck!" cried Meg, and the rehearsal ended in a
title: Little Women

text: general burst of laughter.
title: Little Women

text: "Glad to find you so merry, my girls," said a cheery voice at the door,
title: Little Women

text: and actors and audience turned to welcome a tall, motherly lady with a
title: Little Women

text: 'can I help you' look about her which was truly delightful. She was not
title: Little Women

text: elegantly dressed, but a noble-looking woman, and the girls thought the
title: Little Women

text: gray cloak and unfashionable bonnet covered the most splendid mother in
title: Little Women

text: the world.

text: "Well, dearies, how have you got on today?  There was so much to do,
title: Little Women

text: getting the boxes ready to go tomorrow, that I didn't come home to
title: Little Women

text: dinner.  Has anyone called, Beth?  How is your cold, Meg?  Jo, you look
title: Little Women

text: tired to death.  Come and kiss me, baby."
title: Little Women

text: While making these maternal inquiries Mrs. March got her wet things
title: Little Women

text: off, her warm slippers on, and sitting down in the easy chair, drew Amy
title: Little Women

text: to her lap, preparing to enjoy the happiest hour of her busy day.  The
title: Little Women

text: girls flew about, trying to make things comfortable, each in her own
title: Little Women

text: way.  Meg arranged the tea table, Jo brought wood and set chairs,
title: Little Women

text: dropping, over-turning, and clattering everything she touched.  Beth
title: Little Women

text: trotted to and fro between parlor kitchen, quiet and busy, while Amy
title: Little Women

text: gave directions to everyone, as she sat with her hands folded.
title: Little Women

text: As they gathered about the table, Mrs. March said, with a particularly
title: Little Women

text: happy face, "I've got a treat for you after supper."
title: Little Women

text: A quick, bright smile went round like a streak of sunshine. Beth
title: Little Women

text: clapped her hands, regardless of the biscuit she held, and Jo tossed up
title: Little Women

text: her napkin, crying, "A letter!  A letter!  Three cheers for Father!"
title: Little Women

text: "Yes, a nice long letter.  He is well, and thinks he shall get through
title: Little Women

text: the cold season better than we feared.  He sends all sorts of loving
title: Little Women

text: wishes for Christmas, and an especial message to you girls," said Mrs.
title: Little Women

text: March, patting her pocket as if she had got a treasure there.
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: over your plate, Amy," cried Jo, choking on her tea and dropping her
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: over the delight to come, till the others were ready.
title: Little Women

text: "I think it was so splendid in Father to go as chaplain when he was too
title: Little Women

text: old to be drafted, and not strong enough for a soldier," said Meg
title: Little Women

text: warmly.
title: Little Women

text: "Don't I wish I could go as a drummer, a vivan--what's its name?  Or a
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: "It must be very disagreeable to sleep in a tent, and eat all sorts of
title: Little Women

text: bad-tasting things, and drink out of a tin mug," sighed Amy.
title: Little Women

text: "When will he come home, Marmee?" asked Beth, with a little quiver in
title: Little Women

text: her voice.
title: Little Women

text: "Not for many months, dear, unless he is sick.  He will stay and do his
title: Little Women

text: work faithfully as long as he can, and we won't ask for him back a
title: Little Women

text: minute sooner than he can be spared.  Now come and hear the letter."
title: Little Women

text: They all drew to the fire, Mother in the big chair with Beth at her
title: Little Women

text: feet, Meg and Amy perched on either arm of the chair, and Jo leaning on
title: Little Women

text: the back, where no one would see any sign of emotion if the letter
title: Little Women

text: should happen to be touching.  Very few letters were written in those
title: Little Women

text: hard times that were not touching, especially those which fathers sent
title: Little Women

text: home.  In this one little was said of the hardships endured, the
title: Little Women

text: dangers faced, or the homesickness conquered. It was a cheerful,
title: Little Women

text: hopeful letter, full of lively descriptions of camp life, marches, and
title: Little Women

text: military news, and only at the end did the writer's heart over-flow
title: Little Women

text: with fatherly love and longing for the little girls at home.
title: Little Women

text: "Give them all of my dear love and a kiss.  Tell them I think of them
title: Little Women

text: by day, pray for them by night, and find my best comfort in their
title: Little Women

text: affection at all times.  A year seems very long to wait before I see
title: Little Women

text: them, but remind them that while we wait we may all work, so that these
title: Little Women

text: hard days need not be wasted.  I know they will remember all I said to
title: Little Women

text: them, that they will be loving children to you, will do their duty
title: Little Women

text: faithfully, fight their bosom enemies bravely, and conquer themselves
title: Little Women

text: so beautifully that when I come back to them I may be fonder and
title: Little Women

text: prouder than ever of my little women." Everybody sniffed when they came
title: Little Women

text: to that part.  Jo wasn't ashamed of the great tear that dropped off the
title: Little Women

text: end of her nose, and Amy never minded the rumpling of her curls as she
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: A MERRY CHRISTMAS
title: Little Women

text: Jo was the first to wake in the gray dawn of Christmas morning. No
title: Little Women

text: stockings hung at the fireplace, and for a moment she felt as much
title: Little Women

text: disappointed as she did long ago, when her little sock fell down
title: Little Women

text: because it was crammed so full of goodies.  Then she remembered her
title: Little Women

text: mother's promise and, slipping her hand under her pillow, drew out a
title: Little Women

text: little crimson-covered book.  She knew it very well, for it was that
title: Little Women

text: beautiful old story of the best life ever lived, and Jo felt that it
title: Little Women

text: was a true guidebook for any pilgrim going on a long journey.  She woke
title: Little Women

text: Meg with a "Merry Christmas," and bade her see what was under her
title: Little Women

text: pillow.  A green-covered book appeared, with the same picture inside,
title: Little Women

text: and a few words written by their mother, which made their one present
title: Little Women

text: very precious in their eyes.  Presently Beth and Amy woke to rummage
title: Little Women

text: and find their little books also, one dove-colored, the other blue, and
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: with the coming day.
title: Little Women

text: In spite of her small vanities, Margaret had a sweet and pious nature,
title: Little Women

text: which unconsciously influenced her sisters, especially Jo, who loved
title: Little Women

text: her very tenderly, and obeyed her because her advice was so gently
title: Little Women

text: given.
title: Little Women

text: "Girls," said Meg seriously, looking from the tumbled head beside her
title: Little Women

text: to the two little night-capped ones in the room beyond, "Mother wants
title: Little Women

text: us to read and love and mind these books, and we must begin at once.
title: Little Women

text: We used to be faithful about it, but since Father went away and all
title: Little Women

text: this war trouble unsettled us, we have neglected many things.  You can
title: Little Women

text: do as you please, but I shall keep my book on the table here and read a
title: Little Women

text: little every morning as soon as I wake, for I know it will do me good
title: Little Women

text: and help me through the day."
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: her and, leaning cheek to cheek, read also, with the quiet expression
title: Little Women

text: so seldom seen on her restless face.
title: Little Women

text: "How good Meg is!  Come, Amy, let's do as they do.  I'll help you with
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: Not far away from here lies a poor woman with a little newborn baby.

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: gentleman and refused to stir.  This dauntless example fired Zara.  She
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: of the castle.  A stout little retainer came in with chains and led
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: Act third was the castle hall, and here Hagar appeared, having come to
title: Little Women

text: free the lovers and finish Hugo.  She hears him coming and hides, sees
title: Little Women

text: him put the potions into two cups of wine and bid the timid little
title: Little Women

text: servant, "Bear them to the captives in their cells, and tell them I
title: Little Women

text: shall come anon."  The servant takes Hugo aside to tell him something,
title: Little Women

text: and Hagar changes the cups for two others which are harmless.
title: Little Women

text: Ferdinando, the 'minion', carries them away, and Hagar puts back the
title: Little Women

text: cup which holds the poison meant for Roderigo. Hugo, getting thirsty
title: Little Women

text: after a long warble, drinks it, loses his wits, and after a good deal
title: Little Women

text: of clutching and stamping, falls flat and dies, while Hagar informs him
title: Little Women

text: what she has done in a song of exquisite power and melody.
title: Little Women

text: This was a truly thrilling scene, though some persons might have
title: Little Women

text: thought that the sudden tumbling down of a quantity of long red hair
title: Little Women

text: rather marred the effect of the villain's death.  He was called before
title: Little Women

text: the curtain, and with great propriety appeared, leading Hagar, whose
title: Little Women

text: singing was considered more wonderful than all the rest of the
title: Little Women

text: performance put together.
title: Little Women

text: Act fourth displayed the despairing Roderigo on the point of stabbing
title: Little Women

text: himself because he has been told that Zara has deserted him. Just as
title: Little Women

text: the dagger is at his heart, a lovely song is sung under his window,
title: Little Women

text: informing him that Zara is true but in danger, and he can save her if
title: Little Women

text: he will.  A key is thrown in, which unlocks the door, and in a spasm of
title: Little Women

text: rapture he tears off his chains and rushes away to find and rescue his
title: Little Women

text: lady love.
title: Little Women

text: Act fifth opened with a stormy scene between Zara and Don Pedro. He
title: Little Women

text: wishes her to go into a convent, but she won't hear of it, and after a
title: Little Women

text: touching appeal, is about to faint when Roderigo dashes in and demands
title: Little Women

text: her hand.  Don Pedro refuses, because he is not rich. They shout and
title: Little Women

text: gesticulate tremendously but cannot agree, and Rodrigo is about to bear
title: Little Women

text: away the exhausted Zara, when the timid servant enters with a letter
title: Little Women

text: and a bag from Hagar, who has mysteriously disappeared.  The latter
title: Little Women

text: informs the party that she bequeaths untold wealth to the young pair
title: Little Women

text: and an awful doom to Don Pedro, if he doesn't make them happy.  The bag
title: Little Women

text: is opened, and several quarts of tin money shower down upon the stage
title: Little Women

text: till it is quite glorified with the glitter.  This entirely softens the
title: Little Women

text: stern sire.  He consents without a murmur, all join in a joyful chorus,
title: Little Women

text: and the curtain falls upon the lovers kneeling to receive Don Pedro's
title: Little Women

text: blessing in attitudes of the most romantic grace.
title: Little Women

text: Tumultuous applause followed but received an unexpected check, for the
title: Little Women

text: cot bed, on which the dress circle was built, suddenly shut up and
title: Little Women

text: extinguished the enthusiastic audience.  Roderigo and Don Pedro flew to
title: Little Women

text: the rescue, and all were taken out unhurt, though many were speechless
title: Little Women

text: with laughter.  The excitement had hardly subsided when Hannah
title: Little Women

text: appeared, with "Mrs. March's compliments, and would the ladies walk
title: Little Women

text: down to supper."
title: Little Women

text: This was a surprise even to the actors, and when they saw the table,
title: Little Women

text: they looked at one another in rapturous amazement.  It was like Marmee
title: Little Women

text: to get up a little treat for them, but anything so fine as this was
title: Little Women

text: unheard of since the departed days of plenty.  There was ice cream,
title: Little Women

text: actually two dishes of it, pink and white, and cake and fruit and
title: Little Women

text: distracting French bonbons and, in the middle of the table, four great
title: Little Women

text: bouquets of hot house flowers.
title: Little Women

text: It quite took their breath away, and they stared first at the table and
title: Little Women

text: then at their mother, who looked as if she enjoyed it immensely.
title: Little Women

text: "Is it fairies?" asked Amy.

text: "Santa Claus," said Beth.
title: Little Women

text: "Mother did it." And Meg smiled her sweetest, in spite of her gray
title: Little Women

text: beard and white eyebrows.
title: Little Women

text: "Aunt March had a good fit and sent the supper," cried Jo, with a
title: Little Women

text: sudden inspiration.
title: Little Women

text: "All wrong.  Old Mr. Laurence sent it," replied Mrs. March.
title: Little Women

text: "The Laurence boy's grandfather! What in the world put such a thing
title: Little Women

text: into his head?  We don't know him!" exclaimed Meg.
title: Little Women

text: "Hannah told one of his servants about your breakfast party. He is an
title: Little Women

text: odd old gentleman, but that pleased him.  He knew my father years ago,
title: Little Women

text: and he sent me a polite note this afternoon, saying he hoped I would
title: Little Women

text: allow him to express his friendly feeling toward my children by sending
title: Little Women

text: them a few trifles in honor of the day.  I could not refuse, and so you
title: Little Women

text: have a little feast at night to make up for the bread-and-milk
title: Little Women

text: breakfast."
title: Little Women

text: "That boy put it into his head, I know he did!  He's a capital fellow,
title: Little Women

text: and I wish we could get acquainted.  He looks as if he'd like to know
title: Little Women

text: us but he's bashful, and Meg is so prim she won't let me speak to him
title: Little Women

text: when we pass," said Jo, as the plates went round, and the ice began to
title: Little Women

text: melt out of sight, with ohs and ahs of satisfaction.
title: Little Women

text: "You mean the people who live in the big house next door, don't you?"
title: Little Women

text: asked one of the girls.  "My mother knows old Mr. Laurence, but says
title: Little Women

text: he's very proud and doesn't like to mix with his neighbors. He keeps
title: Little Women

text: his grandson shut up, when he isn't riding or walking with his tutor,
title: Little Women

text: and makes him study very hard.  We invited him to our party, but he
title: Little Women

text: didn't come.  Mother says he's very nice, though he never speaks to us
title: Little Women

text: girls."
title: Little Women

text: "Our cat ran away once, and he brought her back, and we talked over the
title: Little Women

text: fence, and were getting on capitally, all about cricket, and so on,
title: Little Women

text: when he saw Meg coming, and walked off.  I mean to know him some day,
title: Little Women

text: for he needs fun, I'm sure he does," said Jo decidedly.
title: Little Women

text: "I like his manners, and he looks like a little gentleman, so I've no
title: Little Women

text: objection to your knowing him, if a proper opportunity comes. He
title: Little Women

text: brought the flowers himself, and I should have asked him in, if I had
title: Little Women

text: been sure what was going on upstairs.  He looked so wistful as he went
title: Little Women

text: away, hearing the frolic and evidently having none of his own."
title: Little Women

text: "It's a mercy you didn't, Mother!" laughed Jo, looking at her boots.
title: Little Women

text: "But we'll have another play sometime that he can see.  Perhaps he'll
title: Little Women

text: help act.  Wouldn't that be jolly?"
title: Little Women

text: "I never had such a fine bouquet before!  How pretty it is!" And Meg
title: Little Women

text: examined her flowers with great interest.
title: Little Women

text: "They are lovely.  But Beth's roses are sweeter to me," said Mrs.
title: Little Women

text: March, smelling the half-dead posy in her belt.
title: Little Women

text: Beth nestled up to her, and whispered softly, "I wish I could send my
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: CHAPTER THREE
title: Little Women

text: THE LAURENCE BOY
title: Little Women

text: "Jo!  Jo!  Where are you?" cried Meg at the foot of the garret stairs.
title: Little Women

text: "Here!" answered a husky voice from above, and, running up, Meg found
title: Little Women

text: her sister eating apples and crying over the Heir of Redclyffe, wrapped
title: Little Women

text: up in a comforter on an old three-legged sofa by the sunny window.
title: Little Women

text: This was Jo's favorite refuge, and here she loved to retire with half a
title: Little Women

text: dozen russets and a nice book, to enjoy the quiet and the society of a
title: Little Women

text: pet rat who lived near by and didn't mind her a particle.  As Meg
title: Little Women

text: appeared, Scrabble whisked into his hole.  Jo shook the tears off her
title: Little Women

text: cheeks and waited to hear the news.
title: Little Women

text: "Such fun!  Only see!  A regular note of invitation from Mrs. Gardiner
title: Little Women

text: for tomorrow night!" cried Meg, waving the precious paper and then
title: Little Women

text: proceeding to read it with girlish delight.
title: Little Women

text: "'Mrs. Gardiner would be happy to see Miss March and Miss Josephine at
title: Little Women

text: a little dance on New Year's Eve.' Marmee is willing we should go, now
title: Little Women

text: what shall we wear?"
title: Little Women

text: "What's the use of asking that, when you know we shall wear our
title: Little Women

text: poplins, because we haven't got anything else?" answered Jo with her
title: Little Women

text: mouth full.
title: Little Women

text: "If I only had a silk!" sighed Meg.  "Mother says I may when I'm
title: Little Women

text: eighteen perhaps, but two years is an everlasting time to wait."
title: Little Women

text: "I'm sure our pops look like silk, and they are nice enough for us.
title: Little Women

text: Yours is as good as new, but I forgot the burn and the tear in mine.
title: Little Women

text: Whatever shall I do?  The burn shows badly, and I can't take any out."
title: Little Women

text: "You must sit still all you can and keep your back out of sight. The
title: Little Women

text: front is all right.  I shall have a new ribbon for my hair, and Marmee
title: Little Women

text: will lend me her little pearl pin, and my new slippers are lovely, and
title: Little Women

text: my gloves will do, though they aren't as nice as I'd like."
title: Little Women

text: "Mine are spoiled with lemonade, and I can't get any new ones, so I
title: Little Women

text: shall have to go without," said Jo, who never troubled herself much
title: Little Women

text: about dress.
title: Little Women

text: "You must have gloves, or I won't go," cried Meg decidedly. "Gloves are
title: Little Women

text: more important than anything else.  You can't dance without them, and
title: Little Women

text: if you don't I should be so mortified."
title: Little Women

text: "Then I'll stay still.  I don't care much for company dancing. It's no
title: Little Women

text: fun to go sailing round.  I like to fly about and cut capers."
title: Little Women

text: "You can't ask Mother for new ones, they are so expensive, and you are
title: Little Women

text: so careless.  She said when you spoiled the others that she shouldn't
title: Little Women

text: get you any more this winter.  Can't you make them do?"
title: Little Women

text: "I can hold them crumpled up in my hand, so no one will know how
title: Little Women

text: stained they are.  That's all I can do.  No!  I'll tell you how we can
title: Little Women

text: manage, each wear one good one and carry a bad one.  Don't you see?"
title: Little Women

text: "Your hands are bigger than mine, and you will stretch my glove
title: Little Women

text: dreadfully," began Meg, whose gloves were a tender point with her.
title: Little Women

text: "Then I'll go without.  I don't care what people say!" cried Jo, taking
title: Little Women

text: up her book.
title: Little Women

text: "You may have it, you may!  Only don't stain it, and do behave nicely.
title: Little Women

text: Don't put your hands behind you, or stare, or say 'Christopher
title: Little Women

text: Columbus!' will you?"
title: Little Women

text: "Don't worry about me.  I'll be as prim as I can and not get into any
title: Little Women

text: scrapes, if I can help it.  Now go and answer your note, and let me
title: Little Women

text: finish this splendid story."
title: Little Women

text: So Meg went away to 'accept with thanks', look over her dress, and sing
title: Little Women

text: blithely as she did up her one real lace frill, while Jo finished her
title: Little Women

text: story, her four apples, and had a game of romps with Scrabble.
title: Little Women

text: On New Year's Eve the parlor was deserted, for the two younger girls
title: Little Women

text: played dressing maids and the two elder were absorbed in the
title: Little Women

text: all-important business of 'getting ready for the party'.  Simple as the
title: Little Women

text: toilets were, there was a great deal of running up and down, laughing
title: Little Women

text: and talking, and at one time a strong smell of burned hair pervaded the
title: Little Women

text: house.  Meg wanted a few curls about her face, and Jo undertook to
title: Little Women

text: pinch the papered locks with a pair of hot tongs.
title: Little Women

text: "Ought they to smoke like that?" asked Beth from her perch on the bed.
title: Little Women

text: "It's the dampness drying," replied Jo.
title: Little Women

text: "What a queer smell!  It's like burned feathers," observed Amy,
title: Little Women

text: smoothing her own pretty curls with a superior air.
title: Little Women

text: "There, now I'll take off the papers and you'll see a cloud of little
title: Little Women

text: ringlets," said Jo, putting down the tongs.
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: "Oh, oh, oh! What have you done?  I'm spoiled!  I can't go!  My hair,
title: Little Women

text: oh, my hair!" wailed Meg, looking with despair at the uneven frizzle on
title: Little Women

text: her forehead.
title: Little Women

text: "Just my luck!  You shouldn't have asked me to do it.  I always spoil
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: tears of regret.
title: Little Women

text: "It isn't spoiled.  Just frizzle it, and tie your ribbon so the ends
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: I've seen many girls do it so," said Amy consolingly.

text: "Serves me right for trying to be fine.  I wish I'd let my hair alone,"
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: Down they went, feeling a trifle timid, for they seldom went to
title: Little Women

text: parties, and informal as this little gathering was, it was an event to
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: "Laurie Laurence, what an odd name."

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: "Oh, dear, how hard it does seem to take up our packs and go on,"
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: the week of merrymaking did not fit her for going on easily with the
title: Little Women

text: task she never liked.
title: Little Women

text: "I wish it was Christmas or New Year's all the time. Wouldn't it be
title: Little Women

text: fun?" answered Jo, yawning dismally.
title: Little Women

text: "We shouldn't enjoy ourselves half so much as we do now. But it does
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: BETH FINDS THE PALACE BEAUTIFUL
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: Amy was comfortably asleep, the house quiet, and Mrs. March sitting by
title: Little Women

text: the bed, she called Jo to her and began to bind up the hurt hands.
title: Little Women

text: "Are you sure she is safe?" whispered Jo, looking remorsefully at the
title: Little Women

text: golden head, which might have been swept away from her sight forever
title: Little Women

text: under the treacherous ice.
title: Little Women

text: "Quite safe, dear.  She is not hurt, and won't even take cold, I think,
title: Little Women

text: you were so sensible in covering and getting her home quickly," replied
title: Little Women

text: her mother cheerfully.
title: Little Women

text: "Laurie did it all.  I only let her go.  Mother, if she should die, it
title: Little Women

text: would be my fault."  And Jo dropped down beside the bed in a passion of
title: Little Women

text: penitent tears, telling all that had happened, bitterly condemning her
title: Little Women

text: hardness of heart, and sobbing out her gratitude for being spared the
title: Little Women

text: heavy punishment which might have come upon her.
title: Little Women

text: "It's my dreadful temper!  I try to cure it, I think I have, and then
title: Little Women

text: it breaks out worse than ever.  Oh, Mother, what shall I do?  What
title: Little Women

text: shall I do?" cried poor Jo, in despair.
title: Little Women

text: "Watch and pray, dear, never get tired of trying, and never think it is
title: Little Women

text: impossible to conquer your fault," said Mrs. March, drawing the blowzy
title: Little Women

text: head to her shoulder and kissing the wet cheek so tenderly that Jo
title: Little Women

text: cried even harder.
title: Little Women

text: "You don't know, you can't guess how bad it is!  It seems as if I could
title: Little Women

text: do anything when I'm in a passion.  I get so savage, I could hurt
title: Little Women

text: anyone and enjoy it.  I'm afraid I shall do something dreadful some
title: Little Women

text: day, and spoil my life, and make everybody hate me. Oh, Mother, help
title: Little Women

text: me, do help me!"
title: Little Women

text: "I will, my child, I will.  Don't cry so bitterly, but remember this
title: Little Women

text: day, and resolve with all your soul that you will never know another
title: Little Women

text: like it.  Jo, dear, we all have our temptations, some far greater than
title: Little Women

text: yours, and it often takes us all our lives to conquer them.  You think
title: Little Women

text: your temper is the worst in the world, but mine used to be just like
title: Little Women

text: it."
title: Little Women

text: "Yours, Mother?  Why, you are never angry!"  And for the moment Jo
title: Little Women

text: forgot remorse in surprise.
title: Little Women

text: "I've been trying to cure it for forty years, and have only succeeded
title: Little Women

text: in controlling it.  I am angry nearly every day of my life, Jo, but I
title: Little Women

text: have learned not to show it, and I still hope to learn not to feel it,
title: Little Women

text: though it may take me another forty years to do so."
title: Little Women

text: The patience and the humility of the face she loved so well was a
title: Little Women

text: better lesson to Jo than the wisest lecture, the sharpest reproof.  She
title: Little Women

text: felt comforted at once by the sympathy and confidence given her.  The
title: Little Women

text: knowledge that her mother had a fault like hers, and tried to mend it,
title: Little Women

text: made her own easier to bear and strengthened her resolution to cure it,
title: Little Women

text: though forty years seemed rather a long time to watch and pray to a
title: Little Women

text: girl of fifteen.
title: Little Women

text: "Mother, are you angry when you fold your lips tight together and go
title: Little Women

text: out of the room sometimes, when Aunt March scolds or people worry you?"
title: Little Women

text: asked Jo, feeling nearer and dearer to her mother than ever before.
title: Little Women

text: "Yes, I've learned to check the hasty words that rise to my lips, and
title: Little Women

text: when I feel that they mean to break out against my will, I just go away
title: Little Women

text: for a minute, and give myself a little shake for being so weak and
title: Little Women

text: wicked," answered Mrs. March with a sigh and a smile, as she smoothed
title: Little Women

text: and fastened up Jo's disheveled hair.
title: Little Women

text: "How did you learn to keep still?  That is what troubles me, for the
title: Little Women

text: sharp words fly out before I know what I'm about, and the more I say
title: Little Women

text: the worse I get, till it's a pleasure to hurt people's feelings and say
title: Little Women

text: dreadful things.  Tell me how you do it, Marmee dear."
title: Little Women

text: "My good mother used to help me..."
title: Little Women

text: "As you do us..." interrupted Jo, with a grateful kiss.
title: Little Women

text: "But I lost her when I was a little older than you are, and for years
title: Little Women

text: had to struggle on alone, for I was too proud to confess my weakness to
title: Little Women

text: anyone else.  I had a hard time, Jo, and shed a good many bitter tears
title: Little Women

text: over my failures, for in spite of my efforts I never seemed to get on.
title: Little Women

text: Then your father came, and I was so happy that I found it easy to be
title: Little Women

text: good.  But by-and-by, when I had four little daughters round me and we
title: Little Women

text: were poor, then the old trouble began again, for I am not patient by
title: Little Women

text: nature, and it tried me very much to see my children wanting anything."
title: Little Women

text: "Poor Mother!  What helped you then?"
title: Little Women

text: "Your father, Jo.  He never loses patience, never doubts or complains,
title: Little Women

text: but always hopes, and works and waits so cheerfully that one is ashamed
title: Little Women

text: to do otherwise before him.  He helped and comforted me, and showed me
title: Little Women

text: that I must try to practice all the virtues I would have my little
title: Little Women

text: girls possess, for I was their example.  It was easier to try for your
title: Little Women

text: sakes than for my own. A startled or surprised look from one of you
title: Little Women

text: when I spoke sharply rebuked me more than any words could have done,
title: Little Women

text: and the love, respect, and confidence of my children was the sweetest
title: Little Women

text: reward I could receive for my efforts to be the woman I would have them
title: Little Women

text: copy."
title: Little Women

text: "Oh, Mother, if I'm ever half as good as you, I shall be satisfied,"
title: Little Women

text: cried Jo, much touched.
title: Little Women

text: "I hope you will be a great deal better, dear, but you must keep watch
title: Little Women

text: over your 'bosom enemy', as father calls it, or it may sadden, if not
title: Little Women

text: spoil your life.  You have had a warning. Remember it, and try with
title: Little Women

text: heart and soul to master this quick temper, before it brings you
title: Little Women

text: greater sorrow and regret than you have known today."
title: Little Women

text: "I will try, Mother, I truly will.  But you must help me, remind me,
title: Little Women

text: and keep me from flying out.  I used to see Father sometimes put his
title: Little Women

text: finger on his lips, and look at you with a very kind but sober face,
title: Little Women

text: and you always folded your lips tight and went away.  Was he reminding
title: Little Women

text: you then?" asked Jo softly.
title: Little Women

text: "Yes.  I asked him to help me so, and he never forgot it, but saved me
title: Little Women

text: from many a sharp word by that little gesture and kind look."
title: Little Women

text: Jo saw that her mother's eyes filled and her lips trembled as she
title: Little Women

text: spoke, and fearing that she had said too much, she whispered anxiously,
title: Little Women

text: "Was it wrong to watch you and to speak of it?  I didn't mean to be
title: Little Women

text: rude, but it's so comfortable to say all I think to you, and feel so
title: Little Women

text: safe and happy here."
title: Little Women

text: "My Jo, you may say anything to your mother, for it is my greatest
title: Little Women

text: happiness and pride to feel that my girls confide in me and know how
title: Little Women

text: much I love them."
title: Little Women

text: "I thought I'd grieved you."
title: Little Women

text: "No, dear, but speaking of Father reminded me how much I miss him, how
title: Little Women

text: much I owe him, and how faithfully I should watch and work to keep his
title: Little Women

text: little daughters safe and good for him."
title: Little Women

text: "Yet you told him to go, Mother, and didn't cry when he went, and never
title: Little Women

text: complain now, or seem as if you needed any help," said Jo, wondering.
title: Little Women

text: "I gave my best to the country I love, and kept my tears till he was
title: Little Women

text: gone.  Why should I complain, when we both have merely done our duty
title: Little Women

text: and will surely be the happier for it in the end?  If I don't seem to
title: Little Women

text: need help, it is because I have a better friend, even than Father, to
title: Little Women

text: comfort and sustain me.  My child, the troubles and temptations of your
title: Little Women

text: life are beginning and may be many, but you can overcome and outlive
title: Little Women

text: them all if you learn to feel the strength and tenderness of your
title: Little Women

text: Heavenly Father as you do that of your earthly one.  The more you love
title: Little Women

text: and trust Him, the nearer you will feel to Him, and the less you will
title: Little Women

text: depend on human power and wisdom.  His love and care never tire or
title: Little Women

text: change, can never be taken from you, but may become the source of
title: Little Women

text: lifelong peace, happiness, and strength.  Believe this heartily, and go
title: Little Women

text: to God with all your little cares, and hopes, and sins, and sorrows, as
title: Little Women

text: freely and confidingly as you come to your mother."
title: Little Women

text: Jo's only answer was to hold her mother close, and in the silence which
title: Little Women

text: followed the sincerest prayer she had ever prayed left her heart
title: Little Women

text: without words.  For in that sad yet happy hour, she had learned not
title: Little Women

text: only the bitterness of remorse and despair, but the sweetness of
title: Little Women

text: self-denial and self-control, and led by her mother's hand, she had
title: Little Women

text: drawn nearer to the Friend who always welcomes every child with a love
title: Little Women

text: stronger than that of any father, tenderer than that of any mother.
title: Little Women

text: Amy stirred and sighed in her sleep, and as if eager to begin at once
title: Little Women

text: to mend her fault, Jo looked up with an expression on her face which it
title: Little Women

text: had never worn before.
title: Little Women

text: "I let the sun go down on my anger.  I wouldn't forgive her, and today,
title: Little Women

text: if it hadn't been for Laurie, it might have been too late!  How could I
title: Little Women

text: be so wicked?" said Jo, half aloud, as she leaned over her sister
title: Little Women

text: softly stroking the wet hair scattered on the pillow.
title: Little Women

text: As if she heard, Amy opened her eyes, and held out her arms, with a
title: Little Women

text: smile that went straight to Jo's heart.  Neither said a word, but they
title: Little Women

text: hugged one another close, in spite of the blankets, and everything was
title: Little Women

text: forgiven and forgotten in one hearty kiss.

text: MEG GOES TO VANITY FAIR
title: Little Women

text: "I do think it was the most fortunate thing in the world that those
title: Little Women

text: children should have the measles just now," said Meg, one April day, as
title: Little Women

text: she stood packing the 'go abroady' trunk in her room, surrounded by her
title: Little Women

text: sisters.
title: Little Women

text: "And so nice of Annie Moffat not to forget her promise.  A whole
title: Little Women

text: fortnight of fun will be regularly splendid," replied Jo, looking like
title: Little Women

text: a windmill as she folded skirts with her long arms.
title: Little Women

text: "And such lovely weather, I'm so glad of that," added Beth, tidily
title: Little Women

text: sorting neck and hair ribbons in her best box, lent for the great
title: Little Women

text: occasion.
title: Little Women

text: "I wish I was going to have a fine time and wear all these nice
title: Little Women

text: things," said Amy with her mouth full of pins, as she artistically
title: Little Women

text: replenished her sister's cushion.
title: Little Women

text: "I wish you were all going, but as you can't, I shall keep my
title: Little Women

text: adventures to tell you when I come back.  I'm sure it's the least I can
title: Little Women

text: do when you have been so kind, lending me things and helping me get
title: Little Women

text: ready," said Meg, glancing round the room at the very simple outfit,
title: Little Women

text: which seemed nearly perfect in their eyes.
title: Little Women

text: "What did Mother give you out of the treasure box?" asked Amy, who had
title: Little Women

text: not been present at the opening of a certain cedar chest in which Mrs.
title: Little Women

text: March kept a few relics of past splendor, as gifts for her girls when
title: Little Women

text: the proper time came.
title: Little Women

text: "A pair of silk stockings, that pretty carved fan, and a lovely blue
title: Little Women

text: sash.  I wanted the violet silk, but there isn't time to make it over,
title: Little Women

text: so I must be contented with my old tarlaton."
title: Little Women

text: "It will look nice over my new muslin skirt, and the sash will set it
title: Little Women

text: off beautifully.  I wish I hadn't smashed my coral bracelet, for you
title: Little Women

text: might have had it," said Jo, who loved to give and lend, but whose
title: Little Women

text: possessions were usually too dilapidated to be of much use.
title: Little Women

text: "There is a lovely old-fashioned pearl set in the treasure chest, but
title: Little Women

text: Mother said real flowers were the prettiest ornament for a young girl,
title: Little Women

text: and Laurie promised to send me all I want," replied Meg.  "Now, let me
title: Little Women

text: see, there's my new gray walking suit, just curl up the feather in my
title: Little Women

text: hat, Beth, then my poplin for Sunday and the small party, it looks
title: Little Women

text: heavy for spring, doesn't it?  The violet silk would be so nice.  Oh,
title: Little Women

text: dear!"
title: Little Women

text: "Never mind, you've got the tarlaton for the big party, and you always
title: Little Women

text: look like an angel in white," said Amy, brooding over the little store
title: Little Women

text: of finery in which her soul delighted.
title: Little Women

text: "It isn't low-necked, and it doesn't sweep enough, but it will have to
title: Little Women

text: do.  My blue housedress looks so well, turned and freshly trimmed, that
title: Little Women

text: I feel as if I'd got a new one.  My silk sacque isn't a bit the
title: Little Women

text: fashion, and my bonnet doesn't look like Sallie's.  I didn't like to
title: Little Women

text: say anything, but I was sadly disappointed in my umbrella.  I told
title: Little Women

text: Mother black with a white handle, but she forgot and bought a green one
title: Little Women

text: with a yellowish handle.  It's strong and neat, so I ought not to
title: Little Women

text: complain, but I know I shall feel ashamed of it beside Annie's silk one
title: Little Women

text: with a gold top," sighed Meg, surveying the little umbrella with great
title: Little Women

text: disfavor.
title: Little Women

text: "Change it," advised Jo.
title: Little Women

text: "I won't be so silly, or hurt Marmee's feelings, when she took so much
title: Little Women

text: pains to get my things.  It's a nonsensical notion of mine, and I'm not
title: Little Women

text: going to give up to it.  My silk stockings and two pairs of new gloves
title: Little Women

text: are my comfort.  You are a dear to lend me yours, Jo.  I feel so rich
title: Little Women

text: and sort of elegant, with two new pairs, and the old ones cleaned up
title: Little Women

text: for common."  And Meg took a refreshing peep at her glove box.
title: Little Women

text: "Annie Moffat has blue and pink bows on her nightcaps. Would you put
title: Little Women

text: some on mine?" she asked, as Beth brought up a pile of snowy muslins,
title: Little Women

text: fresh from Hannah's hands.
title: Little Women

text: "No, I wouldn't, for the smart caps won't match the plain gowns without
title: Little Women

text: any trimming on them.  Poor folks shouldn't rig," said Jo decidedly.
title: Little Women

text: "I wonder if I shall ever be happy enough to have real lace on my
title: Little Women

text: clothes and bows on my caps?" said Meg impatiently.
title: Little Women

text: "You said the other day that you'd be perfectly happy if you could only
title: Little Women

text: go to Annie Moffat's," observed Beth in her quiet way.
title: Little Women

text: "So I did!  Well, I am happy, and I won't fret, but it does seem as if
title: Little Women

text: the more one gets the more one wants, doesn't it?  There now, the trays
title: Little Women

text: are ready, and everything in but my ball dress, which I shall leave for
title: Little Women

text: Mother to pack," said Meg, cheering up, as she glanced from the
title: Little Women

text: half-filled trunk to the many times pressed and mended white tarlaton,
title: Little Women

text: which she called her 'ball dress' with an important air.
title: Little Women

text: The next day was fine, and Meg departed in style for a fortnight of
title: Little Women

text: novelty and pleasure.  Mrs. March had consented to the visit rather
title: Little Women

text: reluctantly, fearing that Margaret would come back more discontented
title: Little Women

text: than she went.  But she begged so hard, and Sallie had promised to take
title: Little Women

text: good care of her, and a little pleasure seemed so delightful after a
title: Little Women

text: winter of irksome work that the mother yielded, and the daughter went
title: Little Women

text: to take her first taste of fashionable life.
title: Little Women

text: The Moffats were very fashionable, and simple Meg was rather daunted,
title: Little Women

text: at first, by the splendor of the house and the elegance of its
title: Little Women

text: occupants.  But they were kindly people, in spite of the frivolous life
title: Little Women

text: they led, and soon put their guest at her ease. Perhaps Meg felt,
title: Little Women

text: without understanding why, that they were not particularly cultivated
title: Little Women

text: or intelligent people, and that all their gilding could not quite
title: Little Women

text: conceal the ordinary material of which they were made.  It certainly
title: Little Women

text: was agreeable to fare sumptuously, drive in a fine carriage, wear her
title: Little Women

text: best frock every day, and do nothing but enjoy herself.  It suited her
title: Little Women

text: exactly, and soon she began to imitate the manners and conversation of
title: Little Women

text: those about her, to put on little airs and graces, use French phrases,
title: Little Women

text: crimp her hair, take in her dresses, and talk about the fashions as
title: Little Women

text: well as she could.  The more she saw of Annie Moffat's pretty things,
title: Little Women

text: the more she envied her and sighed to be rich.  Home now looked bare
title: Little Women

text: and dismal as she thought of it, work grew harder than ever, and she
title: Little Women

text: felt that she was a very destitute and much-injured girl, in spite of
title: Little Women

text: the new gloves and silk stockings.
title: Little Women

text: She had not much time for repining, however, for the three young girls
title: Little Women

text: were busily employed in 'having a good time'.  They shopped, walked,
title: Little Women

text: rode, and called all day, went to theaters and operas or frolicked at
title: Little Women

text: home in the evening, for Annie had many friends and knew how to
title: Little Women

text: entertain them.  Her older sisters were very fine young ladies, and one
title: Little Women

text: was engaged, which was extremely interesting and romantic, Meg thought.
title: Little Women

text: Mr. Moffat was a fat, jolly old gentleman, who knew her father, and
title: Little Women

text: Mrs. Moffat, a fat, jolly old lady, who took as great a fancy to Meg as
title: Little Women

text: her daughter had done.  Everyone petted her, and 'Daisey', as they
title: Little Women

text: called her, was in a fair way to have her head turned.
title: Little Women

text: When the evening for the small party came, she found that the poplin
title: Little Women

text: wouldn't do at all, for the other girls were putting on thin dresses
title: Little Women

text: and making themselves very fine indeed.  So out came the tarlatan,
title: Little Women

text: looking older, limper, and shabbier than ever beside Sallie's crisp new
title: Little Women

text: one.  Meg saw the girls glance at it and then at one another, and her
title: Little Women

text: cheeks began to burn, for with all her gentleness she was very proud.
title: Little Women

text: No one said a word about it, but Sallie offered to dress her hair, and
title: Little Women

text: Annie to tie her sash, and Belle, the engaged sister, praised her white
title: Little Women

text: arms.  But in their kindness Meg saw only pity for her poverty, and her
title: Little Women

text: heart felt very heavy as she stood by herself, while the others
title: Little Women

text: laughed, chattered, and flew about like gauzy butterflies.  The hard,
title: Little Women

text: bitter feeling was getting pretty bad, when the maid brought in a box
title: Little Women

text: of flowers.  Before she could speak, Annie had the cover off, and all
title: Little Women

text: were exclaiming at the lovely roses, heath, and fern within.
title: Little Women

text: "It's for Belle, of course, George always sends her some, but these are
title: Little Women

text: altogether ravishing," cried Annie, with a great sniff.
title: Little Women

text: "They are for Miss March, the man said.  And here's a note," put in the
title: Little Women

text: maid, holding it to Meg.
title: Little Women

text: "What fun!  Who are they from?  Didn't know you had a lover," cried the
title: Little Women

text: girls, fluttering about Meg in a high state of curiosity and surprise.
title: Little Women

text: "The note is from Mother, and the flowers from Laurie," said Meg
title: Little Women

text: simply, yet much gratified that he had not forgotten her.
title: Little Women

text: "Oh, indeed!" said Annie with a funny look, as Meg slipped the note
title: Little Women

text: into her pocket as a sort of talisman against envy, vanity, and false
title: Little Women

text: pride, for the few loving words had done her good, and the flowers
title: Little Women

text: cheered her up by their beauty.
title: Little Women

text: Feeling almost happy again, she laid by a few ferns and roses for
title: Little Women

text: herself, and quickly made up the rest in dainty bouquets for the
title: Little Women

text: breasts, hair, or skirts of her friends, offering them so prettily that
title: Little Women

text: Clara, the elder sister, told her she was 'the sweetest little thing
title: Little Women

text: she ever saw', and they looked quite charmed with her small attention.
title: Little Women

text: Somehow the kind act finished her despondency, and when all the rest
title: Little Women

text: went to show themselves to Mrs. Moffat, she saw a happy, bright-eyed
title: Little Women

text: face in the mirror, as she laid her ferns against her rippling hair and
title: Little Women

text: fastened the roses in the dress that didn't strike her as so very
title: Little Women

text: shabby now.
title: Little Women

text: She enjoyed herself very much that evening, for she danced to her
title: Little Women

text: heart's content.  Everyone was very kind, and she had three
title: Little Women

text: compliments.  Annie made her sing, and some one said she had a
title: Little Women

text: remarkably fine voice.  Major Lincoln asked who 'the fresh little girl

text: with the beautiful eyes' was, and Mr. Moffat insisted on dancing with
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: gracefully expressed it.  So altogether she had a very nice time, till
title: Little Women

text: she overheard a bit of conversation, which disturbed her extremely.
title: Little Women

text: She was sitting just inside the conservatory, waiting for her partner
title: Little Women

text: to bring her an ice, when she heard a voice ask on the other side of
title: Little Women

text: the flowery wall...
title: Little Women

text: "How old is he?"
title: Little Women

text: "Sixteen or seventeen, I should say," replied another voice.
title: Little Women

text: "It would be a grand thing for one of those girls, wouldn't it?  Sallie
title: Little Women

text: says they are very intimate now, and the old man quite dotes on them."
title: Little Women

text: "Mrs. M.  has made her plans, I dare say, and will play her cards well,
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: Moffat.

title: Little Women

text: when the flowers came quite prettily.  Poor thing! She'd be so nice if
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: Here Meg's partner appeared, to find her looking much flushed and
title: Little Women

text: rather agitated.  She was proud, and her pride was useful just then,
title: Little Women

text: for it helped her hide her mortification, anger, and disgust at what
title: Little Women

text: she had just heard.  For, innocent and unsuspicious as she was, she
title: Little Women

text: could not help understanding the gossip of her friends.  She tried to
title: Little Women

text: forget it, but could not, and kept repeating to herself, "Mrs. M.  has
title: Little Women

text: made her plans," "that fib about her mamma," and "dowdy tarlaton," till
title: Little Women

text: she was ready to cry and rush home to tell her troubles and ask for
title: Little Women

text: advice.  As that was impossible, she did her best to seem gay, and
title: Little Women

text: being rather excited, she succeeded so well that no one dreamed what an
title: Little Women

text: effort she was making. She was very glad when it was all over and she
title: Little Women

text: was quiet in her bed, where she could think and wonder and fume till
title: Little Women

text: her head ached and her hot cheeks were cooled by a few natural tears.
title: Little Women

text: Those foolish, yet well meant words, had opened a new world to Meg, and
title: Little Women

text: much disturbed the peace of the old one in which till now she had lived
title: Little Women

text: as happily as a child.  Her innocent friendship with Laurie was spoiled
title: Little Women

text: by the silly speeches she had overheard.  Her faith in her mother was a
