title: Little Women

text: they are good."
title: Little Women

text: Jo went and sat on one arm of the chair, looking as if she thought they
title: Little Women

text: were about to join in some very solemn affair. Holding a hand of each,
title: Little Women

text: and watching the two young faces wistfully, Mrs. March said, in her
title: Little Women

text: serious yet cheery way...
title: Little Women

text: "I want my daughters to be beautiful, accomplished, and good. To be
title: Little Women

text: admired, loved, and respected.  To have a happy youth, to be well and
title: Little Women

text: wisely married, and to lead useful, pleasant lives, with as little care
title: Little Women

text: and sorrow to try them as God sees fit to send. To be loved and chosen
title: Little Women

text: by a good man is the best and sweetest thing which can happen to a
title: Little Women

text: woman, and I sincerely hope my girls may know this beautiful
title: Little Women

text: experience.  It is natural to think of it, Meg, right to hope and wait
title: Little Women

text: for it, and wise to prepare for it, so that when the happy time comes,
title: Little Women

text: you may feel ready for the duties and worthy of the joy.  My dear
title: Little Women

text: girls, I am ambitious for you, but not to have you make a dash in the
title: Little Women

text: world, marry rich men merely because they are rich, or have splendid
title: Little Women

text: houses, which are not homes because love is wanting.  Money is a
title: Little Women

text: needful and precious thing, and when well used, a noble thing, but I
title: Little Women

text: never want you to think it is the first or only prize to strive for.
title: Little Women

text: I'd rather see you poor men's wives, if you were happy, beloved,
title: Little Women

text: contented, than queens on thrones, without self-respect and peace."
title: Little Women

text: "Poor girls don't stand any chance, Belle says, unless they put
title: Little Women

text: themselves forward," sighed Meg.
title: Little Women

text: "Then we'll be old maids," said Jo stoutly.
title: Little Women

text: "Right, Jo.  Better be happy old maids than unhappy wives, or
title: Little Women

text: unmaidenly girls, running about to find husbands," said Mrs. March
title: Little Women

text: decidedly.  "Don't be troubled, Meg, poverty seldom daunts a sincere
title: Little Women

text: lover.  Some of the best and most honored women I know were poor girls,
title: Little Women

text: but so love-worthy that they were not allowed to be old maids. Leave
title: Little Women

text: these things to time.  Make this home happy, so that you may be fit for
title: Little Women

text: homes of your own, if they are offered you, and contented here if they
title: Little Women

text: are not.  One thing remember, my girls.  Mother is always ready to be
title: Little Women

text: your confidant, Father to be your friend, and both of us hope and trust
title: Little Women

text: that our daughters, whether married or single, will be the pride and
title: Little Women

text: comfort of our lives."
title: Little Women

text: "We will, Marmee, we will!" cried both, with all their hearts, as she
title: Little Women

text: bade them good night.
title: Little Women

text: CHAPTER TEN
title: Little Women

text: THE P.C. AND P.O.
title: Little Women

text: As spring came on, a new set of amusements became the fashion, and the
title: Little Women

text: lengthening days gave long afternoons for work and play of all sorts.
title: Little Women

text: The garden had to be put in order, and each sister had a quarter of the
title: Little Women

text: little plot to do what she liked with.  Hannah used to say, "I'd know
title: Little Women

text: which each of them gardings belonged to, ef I see 'em in Chiny," and so
title: Little Women

text: she might, for the girls' tastes differed as much as their characters.
title: Little Women

text: Meg's had roses and heliotrope, myrtle, and a little orange tree in it.
title: Little Women

text: Jo's bed was never alike two seasons, for she was always trying
title: Little Women

text: experiments.  This year it was to be a plantation of sun flowers, the
title: Little Women

text: seeds of which cheerful and aspiring plant were to feed Aunt
title: Little Women

text: Cockle-top and her family of chicks.  Beth had old-fashioned fragrant
title: Little Women

text: flowers in her garden, sweet peas and mignonette, larkspur, pinks,
title: Little Women

text: pansies, and southernwood, with chickweed for the birds and catnip for
title: Little Women

text: the pussies.  Amy had a bower in hers, rather small and earwiggy, but
title: Little Women

text: very pretty to look at, with honeysuckle and morning-glories hanging
title: Little Women

text: their colored horns and bells in graceful wreaths all over it, tall
title: Little Women

text: white lilies, delicate ferns, and as many brilliant, picturesque plants
title: Little Women

text: as would consent to blossom there.
title: Little Women

text: Gardening, walks, rows on the river, and flower hunts employed the fine
title: Little Women

text: days, and for rainy ones, they had house diversions, some old, some
title: Little Women

text: new, all more or less original.  One of these was the 'P.C.', for as
title: Little Women

text: secret societies were the fashion, it was thought proper to have one,
title: Little Women

text: and as all of the girls admired Dickens, they called themselves the
title: Little Women

text: Pickwick Club.  With a few interruptions, they had kept this up for a
title: Little Women

text: year, and met every Saturday evening in the big garret, on which
title: Little Women

text: occasions the ceremonies were as follows:  Three chairs were arranged
title: Little Women

text: in a row before a table on which was a lamp, also four white badges,
title: Little Women

text: with a big 'P.C.' in different colors on each, and the weekly newspaper
title: Little Women

text: called, The Pickwick Portfolio, to which all contributed something,
title: Little Women

text: while Jo, who reveled in pens and ink, was the editor. At seven
title: Little Women

text: o'clock, the four members ascended to the clubroom, tied their badges
title: Little Women

text: round their heads, and took their seats with great solemnity.  Meg, as
title: Little Women

text: the eldest, was Samuel Pickwick, Jo, being of a literary turn, Augustus
title: Little Women

text: Snodgrass, Beth, because she was round and rosy, Tracy Tupman, and Amy,
title: Little Women

text: who was always trying to do what she couldn't, was Nathaniel Winkle.
title: Little Women

text: Pickwick, the president, read the paper, which was filled with original
title: Little Women

text: tales, poetry, local news, funny advertisements, and hints, in which
title: Little Women

text: they good-naturedly reminded each other of their faults and short
title: Little Women

text: comings.  On one occasion, Mr. Pickwick put on a pair of spectacles
title: Little Women

text: without any glass, rapped upon the table, hemmed, and having stared
title: Little Women

text: hard at Mr. Snodgrass, who was tilting back in his chair, till he
title: Little Women

text: arranged himself properly, began to read:
title: Little Women

text: "THE PICKWICK PORTFOLIO"
title: Little Women

text: POET'S CORNER
title: Little Women

text: ANNIVERSARY ODE
title: Little Women

text: Again we meet to celebrate
title: Little Women

text: With badge and solemn rite,
title: Little Women

text: Our fifty-second anniversary,
title: Little Women

text: In Pickwick Hall, tonight.
title: Little Women

text: We all are here in perfect health,
title: Little Women

text: None gone from our small band:
title: Little Women

text: Again we see each well-known face,
title: Little Women

text: And press each friendly hand.
title: Little Women

text: Our Pickwick, always at his post,
title: Little Women

text: With reverence we greet,
title: Little Women

text: As, spectacles on nose, he reads
title: Little Women

text: Our well-filled weekly sheet.
title: Little Women

text: Although he suffers from a cold,
title: Little Women

text: We joy to hear him speak,
title: Little Women

text: For words of wisdom from him fall,
title: Little Women

text: In spite of croak or squeak.
title: Little Women

text: Old six-foot Snodgrass looms on high,
title: Little Women

text: With elephantine grace,
title: Little Women

text: And beams upon the company,
title: Little Women

text: With brown and jovial face.
title: Little Women

text: Poetic fire lights up his eye,
title: Little Women

text: He struggles 'gainst his lot.
title: Little Women

text: Behold ambition on his brow,
title: Little Women

text: And on his nose, a blot.
title: Little Women

text: Next our peaceful Tupman comes,
title: Little Women

text: So rosy, plump, and sweet,
title: Little Women

text: Who chokes with laughter at the puns,
title: Little Women

text: And tumbles off his seat.
title: Little Women

text: Prim little Winkle too is here,
title: Little Women

text: With every hair in place,
title: Little Women

text: A model of propriety,
title: Little Women

text: Though he hates to wash his face.
title: Little Women

text: The year is gone, we still unite
title: Little Women

text: To joke and laugh and read,
title: Little Women

text: And tread the path of literature
title: Little Women

text: That doth to glory lead.
title: Little Women

text: Long may our paper prosper well,
title: Little Women

text: Our club unbroken be,
title: Little Women

text: And coming years their blessings pour
title: Little Women

text: On the useful, gay 'P.  C.'.
title: Little Women

text: A.  SNODGRASS
title: Little Women

text: THE MASKED MARRIAGE
title: Little Women

text: (A Tale Of Venice)
title: Little Women

text: Gondola after gondola swept up to the marble
title: Little Women

text: steps, and left its lovely load to swell the
title: Little Women

text: brilliant throng that filled the stately halls of Count
title: Little Women

text: Adelon.  Knights and ladies, elves and pages, monks
title: Little Women

text: and flower girls, all mingled gaily in the dance.
title: Little Women

text: Sweet voices and rich melody filled the air, and so
title: Little Women

text: with mirth and music the masquerade went on.
title: Little Women

text: "Has your Highness seen the Lady Viola tonight?"
title: Little Women

text: asked a gallant troubadour of the fairy queen who
title: Little Women

text: floated down the hall upon his arm.
title: Little Women

text: "Yes, is she not lovely, though so sad!  Her
title: Little Women

text: dress is well chosen, too, for in a week she weds
title: Little Women

text: Count Antonio, whom she passionately hates."
title: Little Women

text: "By my faith, I envy him.  Yonder he comes,
title: Little Women

text: arrayed like a bridegroom, except the black mask.
title: Little Women

text: When that is off we shall see how he regards the
title: Little Women

text: fair maid whose heart he cannot win, though her
title: Little Women

text: stern father bestows her hand," returned the troubadour.
title: Little Women

text: "Tis whispered that she loves the young English
title: Little Women

text: artist who haunts her steps, and is spurned by the
title: Little Women

text: old Count," said the lady, as they joined the dance.
title: Little Women

text: The revel was at its height when a priest
title: Little Women

text: appeared, and withdrawing the young pair to an alcove,
title: Little Women

text: hung with purple velvet, he motioned them to kneel.
title: Little Women

text: Instant silence fell on the gay throng, and not a
title: Little Women

text: sound, but the dash of fountains or the rustle of
title: Little Women

text: orange groves sleeping in the moonlight, broke the
title: Little Women

text: hush, as Count de Adelon spoke thus:
title: Little Women

text: "My lords and ladies, pardon the ruse by which
title: Little Women

text: I have gathered you here to witness the marriage of
title: Little Women

text: my daughter.  Father, we wait your services."
title: Little Women

text: All eyes turned toward the bridal party, and a
title: Little Women

text: murmur of amazement went through the throng, for
title: Little Women

text: neither bride nor groom removed their masks.  Curiosity
title: Little Women

text: and wonder possessed all hearts, but respect restrained
title: Little Women

text: all tongues till the holy rite was over.  Then the
title: Little Women

text: eager spectators gathered round the count, demanding
title: Little Women

text: an explanation.
title: Little Women

text: "Gladly would I give it if I could, but I only
title: Little Women

text: know that it was the whim of my timid Viola, and I
title: Little Women

text: yielded to it.  Now, my children, let the play end.
title: Little Women

text: Unmask and receive my blessing."
title: Little Women

text: But neither bent the knee, for the young bridegroom
title: Little Women

text: replied in a tone that startled all listeners
title: Little Women

text: as the mask fell, disclosing the noble face of Ferdinand
title: Little Women

text: Devereux, the artist lover, and leaning on the
title: Little Women

text: breast where now flashed the star of an English earl
title: Little Women

text: was the lovely Viola, radiant with joy and beauty.
title: Little Women

text: "My lord, you scornfully bade me claim your
title: Little Women

text: daughter when I could boast as high a name and vast a
title: Little Women

text: fortune as the Count Antonio.  I can do more, for even
title: Little Women

text: your ambitious soul cannot refuse the Earl of Devereux
title: Little Women

text: and De Vere, when he gives his ancient name and boundless
title: Little Women

text: wealth in return for the beloved hand of this fair lady,
title: Little Women

text: now my wife."
title: Little Women

text: The count stood like one changed to stone, and
title: Little Women

text: turning to the bewildered crowd, Ferdinand added, with
title: Little Women

text: a gay smile of triumph, "To you, my gallant friends, I
title: Little Women

text: can only wish that your wooing may prosper as mine has
title: Little Women

text: done, and that you may all win as fair a bride as I have
title: Little Women

text: by this masked marriage."
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: THE HISTORY OF A SQUASH
title: Little Women

text: Once upon a time a farmer planted a little seed
title: Little Women

text: in his garden, and after a while it sprouted and became
title: Little Women

text: a vine and bore many squashes.  One day in October,
title: Little Women

text: when they were ripe, he picked one and took it
title: Little Women

text: to market.  A grocerman bought and put it in his shop.
title: Little Women

text: That same morning, a little girl in a brown hat
title: Little Women

text: and blue dress, with a round face and snub nose, went
title: Little Women

text: and bought it for her mother.  She lugged it home, cut
title: Little Women

text: it up, and boiled it in the big pot, mashed some of it
title: Little Women

text: with salt and butter, for dinner.  And to the rest she added
title: Little Women

text: a pint of milk, two eggs, four spoons of sugar, nutmeg,
title: Little Women

text: and some crackers, put it in a deep dish, and baked it
title: Little Women

text: till it was brown and nice, and next day it was eaten
title: Little Women

text: by a family named March.

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: this fine paper I hope you will pardon his badness and
title: Little Women

text: let him send a French fable because he can't write out
title: Little Women

text: of his head as he has so many lessons to do and no brains
title: Little Women

text: in future I will try to take time by the fetlock and
title: Little Women

text: prepare some work which will be all commy la fo that
title: Little Women

text: means all right I am in haste as it is nearly school
title: Little Women

text: A SAD ACCIDENT
title: Little Women

text: On Friday last, we were startled by a violent shock
title: Little Women

text: in our basement, followed by cries of distress.
title: Little Women

text: On rushing in a body to the cellar, we discovered our beloved
title: Little Women

text: President prostrate upon the floor, having tripped and
title: Little Women

text: fallen while getting wood for domestic purposes.  A perfect
title: Little Women

text: scene of ruin met our eyes, for in his fall Mr. Pickwick
title: Little Women

text: had plunged his head and shoulders into a tub of water,
title: Little Women

text: upset a keg of soft soap upon his manly form,  and torn
title: Little Women

text: his garments badly.  On being removed from this perilous
title: Little Women

text: situation, it was discovered that he had suffered
title: Little Women

text: no injury but several bruises, and we are happy to add,
title: Little Women

text: is now doing well.
title: Little Women

text: ED.
title: Little Women

text: THE PUBLIC BEREAVEMENT
title: Little Women

text: It is our painful duty to record the sudden and
title: Little Women

text: mysterious disappearance of our cherished friend, Mrs.
title: Little Women

text: Snowball Pat Paw.  This lovely and beloved cat was the
title: Little Women

text: pet of a large circle of warm and admiring friends; for
title: Little Women

text: her beauty attracted all eyes, her graces and virtues
title: Little Women

text: endeared her to all hearts, and her loss is deeply felt
title: Little Women

text: by the whole community.
title: Little Women

text: When last seen, she was sitting at the gate, watching
title: Little Women

text: the butcher's cart, and it is feared that some villain,
title: Little Women

text: tempted by her charms, basely stole her.  Weeks have passed,
title: Little Women

text: but no trace of her has been discovered, and we relinquish
title: Little Women

text: all hope, tie a black ribbon to her basket, set aside her
title: Little Women

text: dish, and weep for her as one lost to us forever.
title: Little Women

text: A sympathizing friend sends the following gem:
title: Little Women

text: A LAMENT
title: Little Women

text: (FOR S.  B.  PAT PAW)
title: Little Women

text: We mourn the loss of our little pet,
title: Little Women

text: And sigh o'er her hapless fate,
title: Little Women

text: For never more by the fire she'll sit,
title: Little Women

text: Nor play by the old green gate.
title: Little Women

text: The little grave where her infant sleeps
title: Little Women

text: Is 'neath the chestnut tree.
title: Little Women

text: But o'er her grave we may not weep,
title: Little Women

text: We know not where it may be.
title: Little Women

text: Her empty bed, her idle ball,
title: Little Women

text: Will never see her more;
title: Little Women

text: No gentle tap, no loving purr
title: Little Women

text: Is heard at the parlor door.
title: Little Women

text: Another cat comes after her mice,
title: Little Women

text: A cat with a dirty face,
title: Little Women

text: But she does not hunt as our darling did,
title: Little Women

text: Nor play with her airy grace.
title: Little Women

text: Her stealthy paws tread the very hall
title: Little Women

text: Where Snowball used to play,
title: Little Women

text: But she only spits at the dogs our pet
title: Little Women

text: So gallantly drove away.
title: Little Women

text: She is useful and mild, and does her best,
title: Little Women

text: But she is not fair to see,
title: Little Women

text: And we cannot give her your place dear,
title: Little Women

text: Nor worship her as we worship thee.
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: As the President finished reading the paper (which I beg leave to
title: Little Women

text: assure my readers is a bona fide copy of one written by bona fide girls
title: Little Women

text: once upon a time), a round of applause followed, and then Mr. Snodgrass
title: Little Women

text: rose to make a proposition.
title: Little Women

text: "Mr. President and gentlemen," he began, assuming a parliamentary
title: Little Women

text: attitude and tone, "I wish to propose the admission of a new
title: Little Women

text: member--one who highly deserves the honor, would be deeply grateful for
title: Little Women

text: it, and would add immensely to the spirit of the club, the literary
title: Little Women

text: value of the paper, and be no end jolly and nice.  I propose Mr.
title: Little Women

text: Theodore Laurence as an honorary member of the P.  C.  Come now, do
title: Little Women

text: have him."
title: Little Women

text: Jo's sudden change of tone made the girls laugh, but all looked rather
title: Little Women

text: anxious, and no one said a word as Snodgrass took his seat.
title: Little Women

text: "We'll put it to a vote," said the President.  "All in favor of this
title: Little Women

text: motion please to manifest it by saying, 'Aye'."
title: Little Women

text: A loud response from Snodgrass, followed, to everybody's surprise, by a
title: Little Women

text: timid one from Beth.
title: Little Women

text: "Contrary-minded say, 'No'."
title: Little Women

text: Meg and Amy were contrary-minded, and Mr. Winkle rose to say with great
title: Little Women

text: elegance, "We don't wish any boys, they only joke and bounce about.
title: Little Women

text: This is a ladies' club, and we wish to be private and proper."
title: Little Women

text: "I'm afraid he'll laugh at our paper, and make fun of us afterward,"
title: Little Women

text: observed Pickwick, pulling the little curl on her forehead, as she
title: Little Women

text: always did when doubtful.
title: Little Women

text: Up rose Snodgrass, very much in earnest.  "Sir, I give you my word as a
title: Little Women

text: gentleman, Laurie won't do anything of the sort.  He likes to write,
title: Little Women

text: and he'll give a tone to our contributions and keep us from being
title: Little Women

text: sentimental, don't you see?  We can do so little for him, and he does
title: Little Women

text: so much for us, I think the least we can do is to offer him a place
title: Little Women

text: here, and make him welcome if he comes."
title: Little Women

text: This artful allusion to benefits conferred brought Tupman to his feet,
title: Little Women

text: looking as if he had quite made up his mind.
title: Little Women

text: "Yes; we ought to do it, even if we are afraid.  I say he may come, and
title: Little Women

text: his grandpa, too, if he likes."
title: Little Women

text: This spirited burst from Beth electrified the club, and Jo left her
title: Little Women

text: seat to shake hands approvingly.  "Now then, vote again. Everybody
title: Little Women

text: remember it's our Laurie, and say, 'Aye!'" cried Snodgrass excitedly.
title: Little Women

text: "Aye!  Aye!  Aye!" replied three voices at once.
title: Little Women

text: "Good!  Bless you!  Now, as there's nothing like 'taking time by the
title: Little Women

text: fetlock', as Winkle characteristically observes, allow me to present
title: Little Women

text: the new member."  And, to the dismay of the rest of the club, Jo threw
title: Little Women

text: open the door of the closet, and displayed Laurie sitting on a rag bag,
title: Little Women

text: flushed and twinkling with suppressed laughter.
title: Little Women

text: "You rogue!  You traitor!  Jo, how could you?" cried the three girls,
title: Little Women

text: as Snodgrass led her friend triumphantly forth, and producing both a
title: Little Women

text: chair and a badge, installed him in a jiffy.
title: Little Women

text: "The coolness of you two rascals is amazing," began Mr. Pickwick,
title: Little Women

text: trying to get up an awful frown and only succeeding in producing an
title: Little Women

text: amiable smile.  But the new member was equal to the occasion, and
title: Little Women

text: rising, with a grateful salutation to the Chair, said in the most
title: Little Women

text: engaging manner, "Mr. President and ladies--I beg pardon,
title: Little Women

text: gentlemen--allow me to introduce myself as Sam Weller, the very humble
title: Little Women

text: servant of the club."
title: Little Women

text: "Good!  Good!" cried Jo, pounding with the handle of the old warming
title: Little Women

text: pan on which she leaned.
title: Little Women

text: "My faithful friend and noble patron," continued Laurie with a wave of
title: Little Women

text: the hand, "who has so flatteringly presented me, is not to be blamed
title: Little Women

text: for the base stratagem of tonight.  I planned it, and she only gave in
title: Little Women

text: after lots of teasing."

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: I never will do so again, and henceforth devote myself to the interest

text: of this immortal club."

text: "Hear!  Hear!" cried Jo, clashing the lid of the warming pan like a
title: Little Women

text: cymbal.

text: "Go on, go on!" added Winkle and Tupman, while the President bowed
title: Little Women

text: benignly.
title: Little Women

text: "I merely wish to say, that as a slight token of my gratitude for the
title: Little Women

text: honor done me, and as a means of promoting friendly relations between
title: Little Women

text: adjoining nations, I have set up a post office in the hedge in the
title: Little Women

text: lower corner of the garden, a fine, spacious building with padlocks on
title: Little Women

text: the doors and every convenience for the mails, also the females, if I
title: Little Women

text: may be allowed the expression.  It's the old martin house, but I've
title: Little Women

text: stopped up the door and made the roof open, so it will hold all sorts
title: Little Women

text: of things, and save our valuable time.  Letters, manuscripts, books,
title: Little Women

text: and bundles can be passed in there, and as each nation has a key, it
title: Little Women

text: will be uncommonly nice, I fancy.  Allow me to present the club key,
title: Little Women

text: and with many thanks for your favor, take my seat."
title: Little Women

text: Great applause as Mr. Weller deposited a little key on the table and
title: Little Women

text: subsided, the warming pan clashed and waved wildly, and it was some
title: Little Women

text: time before order could be restored.  A long discussion followed, and
title: Little Women

text: everyone came out surprising, for everyone did her best.  So it was an
title: Little Women

text: unusually lively meeting, and did not adjourn till a late hour, when it
title: Little Women

text: broke up with three shrill cheers for the new member.
title: Little Women

text: No one ever regretted the admittance of Sam Weller, for a more devoted,
title: Little Women

text: well-behaved, and jovial member no club could have. He certainly did
title: Little Women

text: add 'spirit' to the meetings, and 'a tone' to the paper, for his
title: Little Women

text: orations convulsed his hearers and his contributions were excellent,
title: Little Women

text: being patriotic, classical, comical, or dramatic, but never
title: Little Women

text: sentimental.  Jo regarded them as worthy of Bacon, Milton, or
title: Little Women

text: Shakespeare, and remodeled her own works with good effect, she thought.
title: Little Women

text: The P.  O.  was a capital little institution, and flourished
title: Little Women

text: wonderfully, for nearly as many queer things passed through it as
title: Little Women

text: through the real post office.  Tragedies and cravats, poetry and
title: Little Women

text: pickles, garden seeds and long letters, music and gingerbread, rubbers,
title: Little Women

text: invitations, scoldings, and puppies.  The old gentleman liked the fun,
title: Little Women

text: and amused himself by sending odd bundles, mysterious messages, and
title: Little Women

text: funny telegrams, and his gardener, who was smitten with Hannah's
title: Little Women

text: charms, actually sent a love letter to Jo's care.  How they laughed
title: Little Women

text: when the secret came out, never dreaming how many love letters that
title: Little Women

text: little post office would hold in the years to come.

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: "Then let me advise you to take up your little burdens again, for
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: "What do you know about him?" asked Laurie, grateful for the good
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: SECRETS
title: Little Women

text: Jo was very busy in the garret, for the October days began to grow
title: Little Women

text: chilly, and the afternoons were short.  For two or three hours the sun
title: Little Women

text: lay warmly in the high window, showing Jo seated on the old sofa,
title: Little Women

text: writing busily, with her papers spread out upon a trunk before her,
title: Little Women

text: while Scrabble, the pet rat, promenaded the beams overhead, accompanied
title: Little Women

text: by his oldest son, a fine young fellow, who was evidently very proud of
title: Little Women

text: his whiskers. Quite absorbed in her work, Jo scribbled away till the
title: Little Women

text: last page was filled, when she signed her name with a flourish and
title: Little Women

text: threw down her pen, exclaiming...
title: Little Women

text: "There, I've done my best!  If this won't suit I shall have to wait
title: Little Women

text: till I can do better."
title: Little Women

text: Lying back on the sofa, she read the manuscript carefully through,
title: Little Women

text: making dashes here and there, and putting in many exclamation points,
title: Little Women

text: which looked like little balloons.  Then she tied it up with a smart
title: Little Women

text: red ribbon, and sat a minute looking at it with a sober, wistful
title: Little Women

text: expression, which plainly showed how earnest her work had been.  Jo's
title: Little Women

text: desk up here was an old tin kitchen which hung against the wall.  In it
title: Little Women

text: she kept her papers, and a few books, safely shut away from Scrabble,
title: Little Women

text: who, being likewise of a literary turn, was fond of making a
title: Little Women

text: circulating library of such books as were left in his way by eating the
title: Little Women

text: leaves.  From this tin receptacle Jo produced another manuscript, and
title: Little Women

text: putting both in her pocket, crept quietly downstairs, leaving her
title: Little Women

text: friends to nibble on her pens and taste her ink.
title: Little Women

text: She put on her hat and jacket as noiselessly as possible, and going to
title: Little Women

text: the back entry window, got out upon the roof of a low porch, swung
title: Little Women

text: herself down to the grassy bank, and took a roundabout way to the road.
title: Little Women

text: Once there, she composed herself, hailed a passing omnibus, and rolled
title: Little Women

text: away to town, looking very merry and mysterious.
title: Little Women

text: If anyone had been watching her, he would have thought her movements
title: Little Women

text: decidedly peculiar, for on alighting, she went off at a great pace till
title: Little Women

text: she reached a certain number in a certain busy street.  Having found
title: Little Women

text: the place with some difficulty, she went into the doorway, looked up
title: Little Women

text: the dirty stairs, and after standing stock still a minute, suddenly
title: Little Women

text: dived into the street and walked away as rapidly as she came.  This
title: Little Women

text: maneuver she repeated several times, to the great amusement of a
title: Little Women

text: black-eyed young gentleman lounging in the window of a building
title: Little Women

text: opposite.  On returning for the third time, Jo gave herself a shake,
title: Little Women

text: pulled her hat over her eyes, and walked up the stairs, looking as if
title: Little Women

text: she were going to have all her teeth out.

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: "Children, I leave you to Hannah's care and Mr. Laurence's protection.
title: Little Women

text: Hannah is faithfulness itself, and our good neighbor will guard you as
title: Little Women

text: if you were his own.  I have no fears for you, yet I am anxious that
title: Little Women

text: you should take this trouble rightly.  Don't grieve and fret when I am
title: Little Women

text: gone, or think that you can be idle and comfort yourselves by being
title: Little Women

text: idle and trying to forget.  Go on with your work as usual, for work is
title: Little Women

text: a blessed solace.  Hope and keep busy, and whatever happens, remember
title: Little Women

text: that you never can be fatherless."
title: Little Women

text: "Yes, Mother."
title: Little Women

text: "Meg, dear, be prudent, watch over your sisters, consult Hannah, and in
title: Little Women

text: any perplexity, go to Mr. Laurence.  Be patient, Jo, don't get
title: Little Women

text: despondent or do rash things, write to me often, and be my brave girl,
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: can, be obedient, and keep happy safe at home."
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: My dearest Mother:
title: Little Women

text: It is impossible to tell you how happy your last letter made us, for
title: Little Women

text: the news was so good we couldn't help laughing and crying over it.  How
title: Little Women

text: very kind Mr. Brooke is, and how fortunate that Mr. Laurence's business
title: Little Women

text: detains him near you so long, since he is so useful to you and Father.
title: Little Women

text: The girls are all as good as gold.  Jo helps me with the sewing, and
title: Little Women

text: insists on doing all sorts of hard jobs.  I should be afraid she might
title: Little Women

text: overdo, if I didn't know her 'moral fit' wouldn't last long.  Beth is
title: Little Women

text: as regular about her tasks as a clock, and never forgets what you told
title: Little Women

text: her.  She grieves about Father, and looks sober except when she is at
title: Little Women

text: her little piano.  Amy minds me nicely, and I take great care of her.
title: Little Women

text: She does her own hair, and I am teaching her to make buttonholes and
title: Little Women

text: mend her stockings. She tries very hard, and I know you will be pleased
title: Little Women

text: with her improvement when you come.  Mr. Laurence watches over us like
title: Little Women

text: a motherly old hen, as Jo says, and Laurie is very kind and neighborly.
title: Little Women

text: He and Jo keep us merry, for we get pretty blue sometimes, and feel
title: Little Women

text: like orphans, with you so far away.  Hannah is a perfect saint.  She
title: Little Women

text: does not scold at all, and always calls me Miss Margaret, which is
title: Little Women

text: quite proper, you know, and treats me with respect.  We are all well
title: Little Women

text: and busy, but we long, day and night, to have you back.  Give my
title: Little Women

text: dearest love to Father, and believe me, ever your own...

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: Dear Madam:
title: Little Women

text: The little girls are all well.  Beth and my boy report daily. Hannah is
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: LITTLE FAITHFUL
title: Little Women

text: For a week the amount of virtue in the old house would have supplied
title: Little Women

text: the neighborhood.  It was really amazing, for everyone seemed in a
title: Little Women

text: heavenly frame of mind, and self-denial was all the fashion.  Relieved
title: Little Women

text: of their first anxiety about their father, the girls insensibly relaxed
title: Little Women

text: their praiseworthy efforts a little, and began to fall back into old
title: Little Women

text: ways.  They did not forget their motto, but hoping and keeping busy
title: Little Women

text: seemed to grow easier, and after such tremendous exertions, they felt
title: Little Women

text: that Endeavor deserved a holiday, and gave it a good many.
title: Little Women

text: Jo caught a bad cold through neglect to cover the shorn head enough,
title: Little Women

text: and was ordered to stay at home till she was better, for Aunt March
title: Little Women

text: didn't like to hear people read with colds in their heads.  Jo liked
title: Little Women

text: this, and after an energetic rummage from garret to cellar, subsided on
title: Little Women

text: the sofa to nurse her cold with arsenicum and books.  Amy found that
title: Little Women

text: housework and art did not go well together, and returned to her mud
title: Little Women

text: pies.  Meg went daily to her pupils, and sewed, or thought she did, at
title: Little Women

text: home, but much time was spent in writing long letters to her mother, or
title: Little Women

text: reading the Washington dispatches over and over.  Beth kept on, with
title: Little Women

text: only slight relapses into idleness or grieving.
title: Little Women

text: All the little duties were faithfully done each day, and many of her
title: Little Women

text: sisters' also, for they were forgetful, and the house seemed like a
title: Little Women

text: clock whose pendulum was gone a-visiting.  When her heart got heavy
title: Little Women

text: with longings for Mother or fears for Father, she went away into a
title: Little Women

text: certain closet, hid her face in the folds of a dear old gown, and made
title: Little Women

text: her little moan and prayed her little prayer quietly by herself.
title: Little Women

text: Nobody knew what cheered her up after a sober fit, but everyone felt
title: Little Women

text: how sweet and helpful Beth was, and fell into a way of going to her for
title: Little Women

text: comfort or advice in their small affairs.
title: Little Women

text: All were unconscious that this experience was a test of character, and
title: Little Women

text: when the first excitement was over, felt that they had done well and
title: Little Women

text: deserved praise.  So they did, but their mistake was in ceasing to do
title: Little Women

text: well, and they learned this lesson through much anxiety and regret.

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: AMY'S WILL
title: Little Women

text: While these things were happening at home, Amy was having hard times at
title: Little Women

text: Aunt March's.  She felt her exile deeply, and for the first time in her
title: Little Women

text: life, realized how much she was beloved and petted at home.  Aunt March
title: Little Women

text: never petted any one; she did not approve of it, but she meant to be
title: Little Women

text: kind, for the well-behaved little girl pleased her very much, and Aunt
title: Little Women

text: March had a soft place in her old heart for her nephew's children,
title: Little Women

text: though she didn't think it proper to confess it.  She really did her
title: Little Women

text: best to make Amy happy, but, dear me, what mistakes she made. Some old
title: Little Women

text: people keep young at heart in spite of wrinkles and gray hairs, can
title: Little Women

text: sympathize with children's little cares and joys, make them feel at
title: Little Women

text: home, and can hide wise lessons under pleasant plays, giving and
title: Little Women

text: receiving friendship in the sweetest way.  But Aunt March had not this
title: Little Women

text: gift, and she worried Amy very much with her rules and orders, her prim
title: Little Women

text: ways, and long, prosy talks.  Finding the child more docile and amiable
title: Little Women

text: than her sister, the old lady felt it her duty to try and counteract,
title: Little Women

text: as far as possible, the bad effects of home freedom and indulgence.  So
title: Little Women

text: she took Amy by the hand, and taught her as she herself had been taught
title: Little Women

text: sixty years ago, a process which carried dismay to Amy's soul, and made
title: Little Women

text: her feel like a fly in the web of a very strict spider.
title: Little Women

text: She had to wash the cups every morning, and polish up the old-fashioned
title: Little Women

text: spoons, the fat silver teapot, and the glasses till they shone.  Then
title: Little Women

text: she must dust the room, and what a trying job that was.  Not a speck
title: Little Women

text: escaped Aunt March's eye, and all the furniture had claw legs and much
title: Little Women

text: carving, which was never dusted to suit.  Then Polly had to be fed, the
title: Little Women

text: lap dog combed, and a dozen trips upstairs and down to get things or
title: Little Women

text: deliver orders, for the old lady was very lame and seldom left her big
title: Little Women

text: chair.  After these tiresome labors, she must do her lessons, which was
title: Little Women

text: a daily trial of every virtue she possessed.  Then she was allowed one
title: Little Women

text: hour for exercise or play, and didn't she enjoy it?
title: Little Women

text: Laurie came every day, and wheedled Aunt March till Amy was allowed to
title: Little Women

text: go out with him, when they walked and rode and had capital times.
title: Little Women

text: After dinner, she had to read aloud, and sit still while the old lady
title: Little Women

text: slept, which she usually did for an hour, as she dropped off over the
title: Little Women

text: first page.  Then patchwork or towels appeared, and Amy sewed with
title: Little Women

text: outward meekness and inward rebellion till dusk, when she was allowed
title: Little Women

text: to amuse herself as she liked till teatime.  The evenings were the
title: Little Women

text: worst of all, for Aunt March fell to telling long stories about her
title: Little Women

text: youth, which were so unutterably dull that Amy was always ready to go
title: Little Women

text: to bed, intending to cry over her hard fate, but usually going to sleep
title: Little Women

text: before she had squeezed out more than a tear or two.
title: Little Women

text: If it had not been for Laurie, and old Esther, the maid, she felt that
title: Little Women

text: she never could have got through that dreadful time.  The parrot alone
title: Little Women

text: was enough to drive her distracted, for he soon felt that she did not
title: Little Women

text: admire him, and revenged himself by being as mischievous as possible.
title: Little Women

text: He pulled her hair whenever she came near him, upset his bread and milk
title: Little Women

text: to plague her when she had newly cleaned his cage, made Mop bark by
title: Little Women

text: pecking at him while Madam dozed, called her names before company, and
title: Little Women

text: behaved in all respects like an reprehensible old bird.  Then she could
title: Little Women

text: not endure the dog, a fat, cross beast who snarled and yelped at her
title: Little Women

text: when she made his toilet, and who lay on his back with all his legs in
title: Little Women

text: the air and a most idiotic expression of countenance when he wanted
title: Little Women

text: something to eat, which was about a dozen times a day.  The cook was
title: Little Women

text: bad-tempered, the old coachman was deaf, and Esther the only one who
title: Little Women

text: ever took any notice of the young lady.
title: Little Women

text: Esther was a Frenchwoman, who had lived with 'Madame', as she called her
title: Little Women

text: mistress, for many years, and who rather tyrannized over the old lady,
title: Little Women

text: who could not get along without her. Her real name was Estelle, but
title: Little Women

text: Aunt March ordered her to change it, and she obeyed, on condition that
title: Little Women

text: she was never asked to change her religion.  She took a fancy to
title: Little Women

text: Mademoiselle, and amused her very much with odd stories of her life in
title: Little Women

text: France, when Amy sat with her while she got up Madame's laces.  She
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: and pretty things stored away in the big wardrobes and the ancient
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: cases, in which on velvet cushions reposed the ornaments which had
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: CHAPTER TWENTY-ONE
title: Little Women

text: LAURIE MAKES MISCHIEF, AND JO MAKES PEACE
title: Little Women

text: Jo's face was a study next day, for the secret rather weighed upon her,
title: Little Women

text: and she found it hard not to look mysterious and important.  Meg
title: Little Women

text: observed it, but did not trouble herself to make inquiries, for she had
title: Little Women

text: learned that the best way to manage Jo was by the law of contraries, so
title: Little Women

text: she felt sure of being told everything if she did not ask.  She was
title: Little Women

text: rather surprised, therefore, when the silence remained unbroken, and Jo
title: Little Women

text: assumed a patronizing air, which decidedly aggravated Meg, who in turn
title: Little Women

text: assumed an air of dignified reserve and devoted herself to her mother.
title: Little Women

text: This left Jo to her own devices, for Mrs. March had taken her place as
title: Little Women

text: nurse, and bade her rest, exercise, and amuse herself after her long
title: Little Women

text: confinement.  Amy being gone, Laurie was her only refuge, and much as
title: Little Women

text: she enjoyed his society, she rather dreaded him just then, for he was
title: Little Women

text: an incorrigible tease, and she feared he would coax the secret from her.
title: Little Women

text: She was quite right, for the mischief-loving lad no sooner suspected a
title: Little Women

text: mystery than he set himself to find it out, and led Jo a trying life of
title: Little Women

text: it.  He wheedled, bribed, ridiculed, threatened, and scolded; affected
title: Little Women

text: indifference, that he might surprise the truth from her; declared he
title: Little Women

text: knew, then that he didn't care; and at last, by dint of perseverance,
title: Little Women

text: he satisfied himself that it concerned Meg and Mr. Brooke.  Feeling
title: Little Women

text: indignant that he was not taken into his tutor's confidence, he set his
title: Little Women

text: wits to work to devise some proper retaliation for the slight.
title: Little Women

text: Meg meanwhile had apparently forgotten the matter and was absorbed in
title: Little Women

text: preparations for her father's return, but all of a sudden a change
title: Little Women

text: seemed to come over her, and, for a day or two, she was quite unlike
title: Little Women

text: herself.  She started when spoken to, blushed when looked at, was very
title: Little Women

text: quiet, and sat over her sewing, with a timid, troubled look on her
title: Little Women

text: face.  To her mother's inquiries she answered that she was quite well,
title: Little Women

text: and Jo's she silenced by begging to be let alone.
title: Little Women

text: "She feels it in the air--love, I mean--and she's going very fast.
title: Little Women

text: She's got most of the symptoms--is twittery and cross, doesn't eat,
title: Little Women

text: lies awake, and mopes in corners.  I caught her singing that song he
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: In order that we may start afresh and go to Meg's wedding with free
title: Little Women

text: minds, it will be well to begin with a little gossip about the Marches.
title: Little Women

text: And here let me premise that if any of the elders think there is too
title: Little Women

text: much 'lovering' in the story, as I fear they may (I'm not afraid the
title: Little Women

text: young folks will make that objection), I can only say with Mrs. March,
title: Little Women

text: "What can you expect when I have four gay girls in the house, and a
title: Little Women

text: dashing young neighbor over the way?"
title: Little Women

text: The three years that have passed have brought but few changes to the
title: Little Women

text: quiet family.  The war is over, and Mr. March safely at home, busy with
title: Little Women

text: his books and the small parish which found in him a minister by nature
title: Little Women

text: as by grace, a quiet, studious man, rich in the wisdom that is better
title: Little Women

text: than learning, the charity which calls all mankind 'brother', the piety
title: Little Women

text: that blossoms into character, making it august and lovely.
title: Little Women

text: These attributes, in spite of poverty and the strict integrity which
title: Little Women

text: shut him out from the more worldly successes, attracted to him many
title: Little Women

text: admirable persons, as naturally as sweet herbs draw bees, and as
title: Little Women

text: naturally he gave them the honey into which fifty years of hard
title: Little Women

text: experience had distilled no bitter drop.  Earnest young men found the
title: Little Women

text: gray-headed scholar as young at heart as they; thoughtful or troubled
title: Little Women

text: women instinctively brought their doubts to him, sure of finding the
title: Little Women

text: gentlest sympathy, the wisest counsel.  Sinners told their sins to the
title: Little Women

text: pure-hearted old man and were both rebuked and saved.  Gifted men found
title: Little Women

text: a companion in him.  Ambitious men caught glimpses of nobler ambitions
title: Little Women

text: than their own, and even worldlings confessed that his beliefs were
title: Little Women

text: beautiful and true, although 'they wouldn't pay'.
title: Little Women

text: To outsiders the five energetic women seemed to rule the house, and so
title: Little Women

text: they did in many things, but the quiet scholar, sitting among his
title: Little Women

text: books, was still the head of the family, the household conscience,
title: Little Women

text: anchor, and comforter, for to him the busy, anxious women always turned
title: Little Women

text: in troublous times, finding him, in the truest sense of those sacred
title: Little Women

text: words, husband and father.
title: Little Women

text: The girls gave their hearts into their mother's keeping, their souls
title: Little Women

text: into their father's, and to both parents, who lived and labored so
title: Little Women

text: faithfully for them, they gave a love that grew with their growth and
title: Little Women

text: bound them tenderly together by the sweetest tie which blesses life and
title: Little Women

text: outlives death.
title: Little Women

text: Mrs. March is as brisk and cheery, though rather grayer, than when we
title: Little Women

text: saw her last, and just now so absorbed in Meg's affairs that the
title: Little Women

text: hospitals and homes still full of wounded 'boys' and soldiers' widows,
title: Little Women

text: decidedly miss the motherly missionary's visits.
title: Little Women

text: John Brooke did his duty manfully for a year, got wounded, was sent
title: Little Women

text: home, and not allowed to return.  He received no stars or bars, but he
title: Little Women

text: deserved them, for he cheerfully risked all he had, and life and love
title: Little Women

text: are very precious when both are in full bloom.  Perfectly resigned to
title: Little Women

text: his discharge, he devoted himself to getting well, preparing for
title: Little Women

text: business, and earning a home for Meg.  With the good sense and sturdy
title: Little Women

text: independence that characterized him, he refused Mr. Laurence's more
title: Little Women

text: generous offers, and accepted the place of bookkeeper, feeling better
title: Little Women

text: satisfied to begin with an honestly earned salary than by running any
title: Little Women

text: risks with borrowed money.
title: Little Women

text: Meg had spent the time in working as well as waiting, growing womanly
title: Little Women

text: in character, wise in housewifely arts, and prettier than ever, for
title: Little Women

text: love is a great beautifier.  She had her girlish ambitions and hopes,
title: Little Women

text: and felt some disappointment at the humble way in which the new life
title: Little Women

text: must begin.  Ned Moffat had just married Sallie Gardiner, and Meg
title: Little Women

text: couldn't help contrasting their fine house and carriage, many gifts,
title: Little Women

text: and splendid outfit with her own, and secretly wishing she could have
title: Little Women

text: the same.  But somehow envy and discontent soon vanished when she
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: that she forgot Sallie's splendor and felt herself the richest,
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: tomorrow," added Amy, tying a picturesque hat over her picturesque
title: Little Women

text: curls, and enjoying the effect as much as anybody.
title: Little Women

text: "Come, Jo, don't desert a fellow.  I'm in such a state of exhaustion I
title: Little Women

text: can't get home without help.  Don't take off your apron, whatever you
title: Little Women

text: do, it's peculiarly becoming," said Laurie, as Jo bestowed his especial
title: Little Women

text: aversion in her capacious pocket and offered her arm to support his
title: Little Women

text: feeble steps.
title: Little Women

text: "Now, Teddy, I want to talk seriously to you about tomorrow," began Jo,
title: Little Women

text: as they strolled away together.  "You must promise to behave well, and
title: Little Women

text: not cut up any pranks, and spoil our plans."
title: Little Women

text: "Not a prank."
title: Little Women

text: "And don't say funny things when we ought to be sober."
title: Little Women

text: "I never do.  You are the one for that."
title: Little Women

text: "And I implore you not to look at me during the ceremony.  I shall
title: Little Women

text: certainly laugh if you do."
title: Little Women

text: "You won't see me, you'll be crying so hard that the thick fog round
title: Little Women

text: you will obscure the prospect."
title: Little Women

text: "I never cry unless for some great affliction."
title: Little Women

text: "Such as fellows going to college, hey?" cut in Laurie, with suggestive
title: Little Women

text: laugh.
title: Little Women

text: "Don't be a peacock.  I only moaned a trifle to keep the girls company."
title: Little Women

text: "Exactly.  I say, Jo, how is Grandpa this week?  Pretty amiable?"
title: Little Women

text: "Very.  Why, have you got into a scrape and want to know how he'll take
title: Little Women

text: it?" asked Jo rather sharply.
title: Little Women

text: "Now, Jo, do you think I'd look your mother in the face and say 'All
title: Little Women

text: right', if it wasn't?" and Laurie stopped short, with an injured air.
title: Little Women

text: "No, I don't."
title: Little Women

text: "Then don't go and be suspicious.  I only want some money," said
title: Little Women

text: Laurie, walking on again, appeased by her hearty tone.
title: Little Women

text: "You spend a great deal, Teddy."
title: Little Women

text: "Bless you, I don't spend it, it spends itself somehow, and is gone
title: Little Women

text: before I know it."
title: Little Women

text: "You are so generous and kind-hearted that you let people borrow, and
title: Little Women

text: can't say 'No' to anyone.  We heard about Henshaw and all you did for
title: Little Women

text: him.  If you always spent money in that way, no one would blame you,"
title: Little Women

text: said Jo warmly.
title: Little Women

text: "Oh, he made a mountain out of a molehill.  You wouldn't have me let
title: Little Women

text: that fine fellow work himself to death just for want of a little help,
title: Little Women

text: when he is worth a dozen of us lazy chaps, would you?"
title: Little Women

text: "Of course not, but I don't see the use of your having seventeen
title: Little Women

text: waistcoats, endless neckties, and a new hat every time you come home. I
title: Little Women

text: thought you'd got over the dandy period, but every now and then it
title: Little Women

text: breaks out in a new spot.  Just now it's the fashion to be hideous, to
title: Little Women

text: make your head look like a scrubbing brush, wear a strait jacket,
title: Little Women

text: orange gloves, and clumping square-toed boots.  If it was cheap
title: Little Women

text: ugliness, I'd say nothing, but it costs as much as the other, and I
title: Little Women

text: don't get any satisfaction out of it."
title: Little Women

text: Laurie threw back his head, and laughed so heartily at this attack,
title: Little Women

text: that the felt hat fell off, and Jo walked on it, which insult only
title: Little Women

text: afforded him an opportunity for expatiating on the advantages of a
title: Little Women

text: rough-and-ready costume, as he folded up the maltreated hat, and
title: Little Women

text: stuffed it into his pocket.
title: Little Women

text: "Don't lecture any more, there's a good soul!  I have enough all
title: Little Women

text: through the week, and like to enjoy myself when I come home. I'll get
title: Little Women

text: myself up regardless of expense tomorrow and be a satisfaction to my
title: Little Women

text: friends."
title: Little Women

text: "I'll leave you in peace if you'll only let your hair grow. I'm not
title: Little Women

text: aristocratic, but I do object to being seen with a person who looks
title: Little Women

text: like a young prize fighter," observed Jo severely.
title: Little Women

text: "This unassuming style promotes study, that's why we adopt it,"
title: Little Women

text: returned Laurie, who certainly could not be accused of vanity, having
title: Little Women

text: voluntarily sacrificed a handsome curly crop to the demand for
title: Little Women

text: quarter-inch-long stubble.
title: Little Women

text: "By the way, Jo, I think that little Parker is really getting desperate
title: Little Women

text: about Amy.  He talks of her constantly, writes poetry, and moons about
title: Little Women

text: in a most suspicious manner.  He'd better nip his little passion in the
title: Little Women

text: bud, hadn't he?" added Laurie, in a confidential, elder brotherly tone,
title: Little Women

text: after a minute's silence.
title: Little Women

text: "Of course he had.  We don't want any more marrying in this family for
title: Little Women

text: years to come.  Mercy on us, what are the children thinking of?" and Jo
title: Little Women

text: looked as much scandalized as if Amy and little Parker were not yet in
title: Little Women

text: their teens.
title: Little Women

text: "It's a fast age, and I don't know what we are coming to, ma'am. You
title: Little Women

text: are a mere infant, but you'll go next, Jo, and we'll be left
title: Little Women

text: lamenting," said Laurie, shaking his head over the degeneracy of the
title: Little Women

text: times.
title: Little Women

text: "Don't be alarmed.  I'm not one of the agreeable sort.  Nobody will
title: Little Women

text: want me, and it's a mercy, for there should always be one old maid in a
title: Little Women

text: family."
title: Little Women

text: "You won't give anyone a chance," said Laurie, with a sidelong glance
title: Little Women

text: and a little more color than before in his sunburned face. "You won't
title: Little Women

text: show the soft side of your character, and if a fellow gets a peep at it
title: Little Women

text: by accident and can't help showing that he likes it, you treat him as
title: Little Women

text: Mrs. Gummidge did her sweetheart, throw cold water over him, and get so
title: Little Women

text: thorny no one dares touch or look at you."
title: Little Women

text: "I don't like that sort of thing.  I'm too busy to be worried with
title: Little Women

text: nonsense, and I think it's dreadful to break up families so. Now don't
title: Little Women

text: say any more about it.  Meg's wedding has turned all our heads, and we
title: Little Women

text: talk of nothing but lovers and such absurdities.  I don't wish to get
title: Little Women

text: cross, so let's change the subject;"  and Jo looked quite ready to
title: Little Women

text: fling cold water on the slightest provocation.
title: Little Women

text: Whatever his feelings might have been, Laurie found a vent for them in
title: Little Women

text: a long low whistle and the fearful prediction as they parted at the
title: Little Women

text: gate, "Mark my words, Jo, you'll go next."
