text: CHAPTER TWENTY-FIVE
title: Little Women

text: THE FIRST WEDDING
title: Little Women

text: The June roses over the porch were awake bright and early on that
title: Little Women

text: morning, rejoicing with all their hearts in the cloudless sunshine,
title: Little Women

text: like friendly little neighbors, as they were.  Quite flushed with
title: Little Women

text: excitement were their ruddy faces, as they swung in the wind,
title: Little Women

text: whispering to one another what they had seen, for some peeped in at the
title: Little Women

text: dining room windows where the feast was spread, some climbed up to nod
title: Little Women

text: and smile at the sisters as they dressed the bride, others waved a
title: Little Women

text: welcome to those who came and went on various errands in garden, porch,
title: Little Women

text: and hall, and all, from the rosiest full-blown flower to the palest
title: Little Women

text: baby bud, offered their tribute of beauty and fragrance to the gentle
title: Little Women

text: mistress who had loved and tended them so long.
title: Little Women

text: Meg looked very like a rose herself, for all that was best and sweetest
title: Little Women

text: in heart and soul seemed to bloom into her face that day, making it
title: Little Women

text: fair and tender, with a charm more beautiful than beauty. Neither silk,
title: Little Women

text: lace, nor orange flowers would she have.  "I don't want a fashionable
title: Little Women

text: wedding, but only those about me whom I love, and to them I wish to
title: Little Women

text: look and be my familiar self."
title: Little Women

text: So she made her wedding gown herself, sewing into it the tender hopes
title: Little Women

text: and innocent romances of a girlish heart.  Her sisters braided up her
title: Little Women

text: pretty hair, and the only ornaments she wore were the lilies of the
title: Little Women

text: valley, which 'her John' liked best of all the flowers that grew.
title: Little Women

text: "You do look just like our own dear Meg, only so very sweet and lovely
title: Little Women

text: that I should hug you if it wouldn't crumple your dress," cried Amy,
title: Little Women

text: surveying her with delight when all was done.
title: Little Women

text: "Then I am satisfied.  But please hug and kiss me, everyone, and don't
title: Little Women

text: mind my dress.  I want a great many crumples of this sort put into it
title: Little Women

text: today,"  and Meg opened her arms to her sisters, who clung about her
title: Little Women

text: with April faces for a minute, feeling that the new love had not
title: Little Women

text: changed the old.
title: Little Women

text: "Now I'm going to tie John's cravat for him, and then to stay a few
title: Little Women

text: minutes with Father quietly in the study,"  and Meg ran down to perform
title: Little Women

text: these little ceremonies, and then to follow her mother wherever she
title: Little Women

text: went, conscious that in spite of the smiles on the motherly face, there
title: Little Women

text: was a secret sorrow hid in the motherly heart at the flight of the
title: Little Women

text: first bird from the nest.
title: Little Women

text: As the younger girls stand together, giving the last touches to their
title: Little Women

text: simple toilet, it may be a good time to tell of a few changes which
title: Little Women

text: three years have wrought in their appearance, for all are looking their
title: Little Women

text: best just now.
title: Little Women

text: Jo's angles are much softened, she has learned to carry herself with
title: Little Women

text: ease, if not grace.  The curly crop has lengthened into a thick coil,
title: Little Women

text: more becoming to the small head atop of the tall figure.  There is a
title: Little Women

text: fresh collar in her brown cheeks, a soft shine in her eyes, and only
title: Little Women

text: gentle words fall from her sharp tongue today.
title: Little Women

text: Beth has grown slender, pale, and more quiet than ever.  The beautiful,
title: Little Women

text: kind eyes are larger, and in them lies an expression that saddens one,
title: Little Women

text: although it is not sad itself.  It is the shadow of pain which touches
title: Little Women

text: the young face with such pathetic patience, but Beth seldom complains
title: Little Women

text: and always speaks hopefully of 'being better soon'.
title: Little Women

text: Amy is with truth considered 'the flower of the family', for at sixteen
title: Little Women

text: she has the air and bearing of a full-grown woman, not beautiful, but
title: Little Women

text: possessed of that indescribable charm called grace. One saw it in the
title: Little Women

text: lines of her figure, the make and motion of her hands, the flow of her
title: Little Women

text: dress, the droop of her hair, unconscious yet harmonious, and as
title: Little Women

text: attractive to many as beauty itself.  Amy's nose still afflicted her,
title: Little Women

text: for it never would grow Grecian, so did her mouth, being too wide, and
title: Little Women

text: having a decided chin.  These offending features gave character to her
title: Little Women

text: whole face, but she never could see it, and consoled herself with her
title: Little Women

text: wonderfully fair complexion, keen blue eyes, and curls more golden and
title: Little Women

text: abundant than ever.
title: Little Women

text: All three wore suits of thin silver gray (their best gowns for the
title: Little Women

text: summer), with blush roses in hair and bosom, and all three looked just
title: Little Women

text: what they were, fresh-faced, happy-hearted girls, pausing a moment in
title: Little Women

text: their busy lives to read with wistful eyes the sweetest chapter in the
title: Little Women

text: romance of womanhood.
title: Little Women

text: There were to be no ceremonious performances, everything was to be as
title: Little Women

text: natural and homelike as possible, so when Aunt March arrived, she was
title: Little Women

text: scandalized to see the bride come running to welcome and lead her in,
title: Little Women

text: to find the bridegroom fastening up a garland that had fallen down, and
title: Little Women

text: to catch a glimpse of the paternal minister marching upstairs with a
title: Little Women

text: grave countenance and a wine bottle under each arm.
title: Little Women

text: "Upon my word, here's a state of things!" cried the old lady, taking
title: Little Women

text: the seat of honor prepared for her, and settling the folds of her
title: Little Women

text: lavender moire with a great rustle.  "You oughtn't to be seen till the
title: Little Women

text: last minute, child."
title: Little Women

text: "I'm not a show, Aunty, and no one is coming to stare at me, to
title: Little Women

text: criticize my dress, or count the cost of my luncheon.  I'm too happy to
title: Little Women

text: care what anyone says or thinks, and I'm going to have my little
title: Little Women

text: wedding just as I like it.  John, dear, here's your hammer."  And away
title: Little Women

text: went Meg to help 'that man' in his highly improper employment.
title: Little Women

text: Mr. Brooke didn't even say, "Thank you," but as he stooped for the
title: Little Women

text: unromantic tool, he kissed his little bride behind the folding door,
title: Little Women

text: with a look that made Aunt March whisk out her pocket handkerchief with
title: Little Women

text: a sudden dew in her sharp old eyes.
title: Little Women

text: A crash, a cry, and a laugh from Laurie, accompanied by the indecorous
title: Little Women

text: exclamation, "Jupiter Ammon!  Jo's upset the cake again!" caused a
title: Little Women

text: momentary flurry, which was hardly over when a flock of cousins
title: Little Women

text: arrived, and 'the party came in', as Beth used to say when a child.
title: Little Women

text: "Don't let that young giant come near me, he worries me worse than
title: Little Women

text: mosquitoes," whispered the old lady to Amy, as the rooms filled and
title: Little Women

text: Laurie's black head towered above the rest.
title: Little Women

text: "He has promised to be very good today, and he can be perfectly elegant
title: Little Women

text: if he likes," returned Amy, and gliding away to warn Hercules to beware
title: Little Women

text: of the dragon, which warning caused him to haunt the old lady with a
title: Little Women

text: devotion that nearly distracted her.
title: Little Women

text: There was no bridal procession, but a sudden silence fell upon the room
title: Little Women

text: as Mr. March and the young couple took their places under the green
title: Little Women

text: arch.  Mother and sisters gathered close, as if loath to give Meg up.
title: Little Women

text: The fatherly voice broke more than once, which only seemed to make the
title: Little Women

text: service more beautiful and solemn.  The bridegroom's hand trembled
title: Little Women

text: visibly, and no one heard his replies.  But Meg looked straight up in
title: Little Women

text: her husband's eyes, and said, "I will!" with such tender trust in her
title: Little Women

text: own face and voice that her mother's heart rejoiced and Aunt March
title: Little Women

text: sniffed audibly.
title: Little Women

text: Jo did not cry, though she was very near it once, and was only saved
title: Little Women

text: from a demonstration by the consciousness that Laurie was staring
title: Little Women

text: fixedly at her, with a comical mixture of merriment and emotion in his
title: Little Women

text: wicked black eyes.  Beth kept her face hidden on her mother's shoulder,
title: Little Women

text: but Amy stood like a graceful statue, with a most becoming ray of
title: Little Women

text: sunshine touching her white forehead and the flower in her hair.
title: Little Women

text: It wasn't at all the thing, I'm afraid, but the minute she was fairly
title: Little Women

text: married, Meg cried, "The first kiss for Marmee!" and turning, gave it
title: Little Women

text: with her heart on her lips.  During the next fifteen minutes she looked
title: Little Women

text: more like a rose than ever, for everyone availed themselves of their
title: Little Women

text: privileges to the fullest extent, from Mr. Laurence to old Hannah, who,
title: Little Women

text: adorned with a headdress fearfully and wonderfully made, fell upon her
title: Little Women

text: in the hall, crying with a sob and a chuckle, "Bless you, deary, a
title: Little Women

text: hundred times!  The cake ain't hurt a mite, and everything looks
title: Little Women

text: lovely."
title: Little Women

text: Everybody cleared up after that, and said something brilliant, or tried
title: Little Women

text: to, which did just as well, for laughter is ready when hearts are
title: Little Women

text: light.  There was no display of gifts, for they were already in the
title: Little Women

text: little house, nor was there an elaborate breakfast, but a plentiful
title: Little Women

text: lunch of cake and fruit, dressed with flowers. Mr. Laurence and Aunt
title: Little Women

text: March shrugged and smiled at one another when water, lemonade, and
title: Little Women

text: coffee were found to be to only sorts of nectar which the three Hebes
title: Little Women

text: carried round.  No one said anything, till Laurie, who insisted on
title: Little Women

text: serving the bride, appeared before her, with a loaded salver in his
title: Little Women

text: hand and a puzzled expression on his face.
title: Little Women

text: "Has Jo smashed all the bottles by accident?" he whispered, "or am I
title: Little Women

text: merely laboring under a delusion that I saw some lying about loose this
title: Little Women

text: morning?"
title: Little Women

text: "No, your grandfather kindly offered us his best, and Aunt March
title: Little Women

text: actually sent some, but Father put away a little for Beth, and
title: Little Women

text: dispatched the rest to the Soldier's Home.  You know he thinks that
title: Little Women

text: wine should be used only in illness, and Mother says that neither she
title: Little Women

text: nor her daughters will ever offer it to any young man under her roof."
title: Little Women

text: Meg spoke seriously and expected to see Laurie frown or laugh, but he
title: Little Women

text: did neither, for after a quick look at her, he said, in his impetuous
title: Little Women

text: way, "I like that!  For I've seen enough harm done to wish other women
title: Little Women

text: would think as you do."
title: Little Women

text: "You are not made wise by experience, I hope?" and there was an anxious
title: Little Women

text: accent in Meg's voice.
title: Little Women

text: "No.  I give you my word for it.  Don't think too well of me, either,
title: Little Women

text: this is not one of my temptations.  Being brought up where wine is as
title: Little Women

text: common as water and almost as harmless, I don't care for it, but when a
title: Little Women

text: pretty girl offers it, one doesn't like to refuse, you see."
title: Little Women

text: "But you will, for the sake of others, if not for your own. Come,
title: Little Women

text: Laurie, promise, and give me one more reason to call this the happiest
title: Little Women

text: day of my life."
title: Little Women

text: A demand so sudden and so serious made the young man hesitate a moment,
title: Little Women

text: for ridicule is often harder to bear than self-denial. Meg knew that if
title: Little Women

text: he gave the promise he would keep it at all costs, and feeling her
title: Little Women

text: power, used it as a woman may for her friend's good. She did not speak,
title: Little Women

text: but she looked up at him with a face made very eloquent by happiness,
title: Little Women

text: and a smile which said, "No one can refuse me anything today."
title: Little Women

text: Laurie certainly could not, and with an answering smile, he gave her
title: Little Women

text: his hand, saying heartily, "I promise, Mrs. Brooke!"
title: Little Women

text: "I thank you, very, very much."
title: Little Women

text: "And I drink 'long life to your resolution', Teddy," cried Jo,
title: Little Women

text: baptizing him with a splash of lemonade, as she waved her glass and
title: Little Women

text: beamed approvingly upon him.
title: Little Women

text: So the toast was drunk, the pledge made and loyally kept in spite of
title: Little Women

text: many temptations, for with instinctive wisdom, the girls seized a happy
title: Little Women

text: moment to do their friend a service, for which he thanked them all his
title: Little Women

text: life.
title: Little Women

text: After lunch, people strolled about, by twos and threes, through the
title: Little Women

text: house and garden, enjoying the sunshine without and within.  Meg and
title: Little Women

text: John happened to be standing together in the middle of the grass plot,
title: Little Women

text: when Laurie was seized with an inspiration which put the finishing
title: Little Women

text: touch to this unfashionable wedding.
title: Little Women

text: "All the married people take hands and dance round the new-made husband
title: Little Women

text: and wife, as the Germans do, while we bachelors and spinsters prance in
title: Little Women

text: couples outside!" cried Laurie, promenading down the path with Amy,
title: Little Women

text: with such infectious spirit and skill that everyone else followed their
title: Little Women

text: example without a murmur.  Mr. and Mrs. March, Aunt and Uncle Carrol
title: Little Women

text: began it, others rapidly joined in, even Sallie Moffat, after a
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: the ring.  But the crowning joke was Mr. Laurence and Aunt March, for
title: Little Women

text: when the stately old gentleman chasseed solemnly up to the old lady,
title: Little Women

text: she just tucked her cane under her arm, and hopped briskly away to join
title: Little Women

text: hands with the rest and dance about the bridal pair, while the young
title: Little Women

text: folks pervaded the garden like butterflies on a midsummer day.
title: Little Women

text: Want of breath brought the impromptu ball to a close, and then people
title: Little Women

text: began to go.
title: Little Women

text: "I wish you well, my dear, I heartily wish you well, but I think you'll
title: Little Women

text: be sorry for it," said Aunt March to Meg, adding to the bridegroom, as
title: Little Women

text: he led her to the carriage, "You've got a treasure, young man, see that
title: Little Women

text: you deserve it."
title: Little Women

text: "That is the prettiest wedding I've been to for an age, Ned, and I
title: Little Women

text: don't see why, for there wasn't a bit of style about it," observed Mrs.
title: Little Women

text: Moffat to her husband, as they drove away.
title: Little Women

text: "Laurie, my lad, if you ever want to indulge in this sort of thing, get
title: Little Women

text: one of those little girls to help you, and I shall be perfectly
title: Little Women

text: satisfied," said Mr. Laurence, settling himself in his easy chair to
title: Little Women

text: rest after the excitement of the morning.
title: Little Women

text: "I'll do my best to gratify you, Sir," was Laurie's unusually dutiful
title: Little Women

text: reply, as he carefully unpinned the posy Jo had put in his buttonhole.
title: Little Women

text: The little house was not far away, and the only bridal journey Meg had
title: Little Women

text: was the quiet walk with John from the old home to the new. When she
title: Little Women

text: came down, looking like a pretty Quakeress in her dove-colored suit and
title: Little Women

text: straw bonnet tied with white, they all gathered about her to say
title: Little Women

text: 'good-by', as tenderly as if she had been going to make the grand tour.
title: Little Women

text: "Don't feel that I am separated from you, Marmee dear, or that I love
title: Little Women

text: you any the less for loving John so much," she said, clinging to her
title: Little Women

text: mother, with full eyes for a moment.  "I shall come every day, Father,
title: Little Women

text: and expect to keep my old place in all your hearts, though I am
title: Little Women

text: married.  Beth is going to be with me a great deal, and the other girls
title: Little Women

text: will drop in now and then to laugh at my housekeeping struggles. Thank
title: Little Women

text: you all for my happy wedding day.  Good-by, good-by!"
title: Little Women

text: They stood watching her, with faces full of love and hope and tender
title: Little Women

text: pride as she walked away, leaning on her husband's arm, with her hands
title: Little Women

text: full of flowers and the June sunshine brightening her happy face--and
title: Little Women

text: so Meg's married life began.

text: CHAPTER TWENTY-SIX
title: Little Women

text: ARTISTIC ATTEMPTS
title: Little Women

text: It takes people a long time to learn the difference between talent and
title: Little Women

text: genius, especially ambitious young men and women.  Amy was learning
title: Little Women

text: this distinction through much tribulation, for mistaking enthusiasm for
title: Little Women

text: inspiration, she attempted every branch of art with youthful audacity.
title: Little Women

text: For a long time there was a lull in the 'mud-pie' business, and she
title: Little Women

text: devoted herself to the finest pen-and-ink drawing, in which she showed
title: Little Women

text: such taste and skill that her graceful handiwork proved both pleasant
title: Little Women

text: and profitable.  But over-strained eyes caused pen and ink to be laid
title: Little Women

text: aside for a bold attempt at poker-sketching. While this attack lasted,
title: Little Women

text: the family lived in constant fear of a conflagration, for the odor of
title: Little Women

text: burning wood pervaded the house at all hours, smoke issued from attic
title: Little Women

text: and shed with alarming frequency, red-hot pokers lay about
title: Little Women

text: promiscuously, and Hannah never went to bed without a pail of water and
title: Little Women

text: the dinner bell at her door in case of fire.  Raphael's face was found
title: Little Women

text: boldly executed on the underside of the moulding board, and Bacchus on
title: Little Women

text: the head of a beer barrel.  A chanting cherub adorned the cover of the
title: Little Women

text: sugar bucket, and attempts to portray Romeo and Juliet supplied
title: Little Women

text: kindling for some time.
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: She was learning, doing, and enjoying other things, meanwhile, for she
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: CHAPTER TWENTY-EIGHT
title: Little Women

text: DOMESTIC EXPERIENCES
title: Little Women

text: Like most other young matrons, Meg began her married life with the
title: Little Women

text: determination to be a model housekeeper.  John should find home a
title: Little Women

text: paradise, he should always see a smiling face, should fare sumptuously
title: Little Women

text: every day, and never know the loss of a button.  She brought so much
title: Little Women

text: love, energy, and cheerfulness to the work that she could not but
title: Little Women

text: succeed, in spite of some obstacles.  Her paradise was not a tranquil
title: Little Women

text: one, for the little woman fussed, was over-anxious to please, and
title: Little Women

text: bustled about like a true Martha, cumbered with many cares.  She was
title: Little Women

text: too tired, sometimes, even to smile, John grew dyspeptic after a course
title: Little Women

text: of dainty dishes and ungratefully demanded plain fare.  As for buttons,
title: Little Women

text: she soon learned to wonder where they went, to shake her head over the
title: Little Women

text: carelessness of men, and to threaten to make him sew them on himself,
title: Little Women

text: and see if his work would stand impatient and clumsy fingers any better
title: Little Women

text: than hers.
title: Little Women

text: They were very happy, even after they discovered that they couldn't
title: Little Women

text: live on love alone.  John did not find Meg's beauty diminished, though
title: Little Women

text: she beamed at him from behind the familiar coffee pot.  Nor did Meg
title: Little Women

text: miss any of the romance from the daily parting, when her husband
title: Little Women

text: followed up his kiss with the tender inquiry, "Shall I send some veal
title: Little Women

text: or mutton for dinner, darling?" The little house ceased to be a
title: Little Women

text: glorified bower, but it became a home, and the young couple soon felt
title: Little Women

text: that it was a change for the better.  At first they played keep-house,
title: Little Women

text: and frolicked over it like children.  Then John took steadily to
title: Little Women

text: business, feeling the cares of the head of a family upon his shoulders,
title: Little Women

text: and Meg laid by her cambric wrappers, put on a big apron, and fell to
title: Little Women

text: work, as before said, with more energy than discretion.
title: Little Women

text: While the cooking mania lasted she went through Mrs. Cornelius's
title: Little Women

text: Receipt Book as if it were a mathematical exercise, working out the
title: Little Women

text: problems with patience and care.  Sometimes her family were invited in
title: Little Women

text: to help eat up a too bounteous feast of successes, or Lotty would be
title: Little Women

text: privately dispatched with a batch of failures, which were to be
title: Little Women

text: concealed from all eyes in the convenient stomachs of the little
title: Little Women

text: Hummels.  An evening with John over the account books usually produced
title: Little Women

text: a temporary lull in the culinary enthusiasm, and a frugal fit would
title: Little Women

text: ensue, during which the poor man was put through a course of bread
title: Little Women

text: pudding, hash, and warmed-over coffee, which tried his soul, although
title: Little Women

text: he bore it with praiseworthy fortitude.  Before the golden mean was
title: Little Women

text: found, however, Meg added to her domestic possessions what young
title: Little Women

text: couples seldom get on long without, a family jar.

text: Fired with a housewifely wish to see her storeroom stocked with
title: Little Women

text: homemade preserves, she undertook to put up her own currant jelly. John
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: to anything, and took a natural pride in her skill, he resolved that
title: Little Women

text: she should be gratified, and their only crop of fruit laid by in a most
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: Now, in the first flush of the new life, she had often said, "My
title: Little Women

text: husband shall always feel free to bring a friend home whenever he
title: Little Women

text: likes.  I shall always be prepared.  There shall be no flurry, no
title: Little Women

text: scolding, no discomfort, but a neat house, a cheerful wife, and a good
title: Little Women

text: dinner.  John, dear, never stop to ask my leave, invite whom you
title: Little Women

text: please, and be sure of a welcome from me."
title: Little Women

text: How charming that was, to be sure!  John quite glowed with pride to
title: Little Women

text: hear her say it, and felt what a blessed thing it was to have a
title: Little Women

text: superior wife.  But, although they had had company from time to time,
title: Little Women

text: it never happened to be unexpected, and Meg had never had an
title: Little Women

text: opportunity to distinguish herself till now.  It always happens so in
title: Little Women

text: this vale of tears, there is an inevitability about such things which
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: present, and what a blissful state of things ensued.  John came home

text: early, Meg gadded no more, and that greatcoat was put on in the morning

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: Leaving her sister to her own devices, Amy proceeded to enjoy herself
title: Little Women

text: to her heart's content.  Mr. Tudor's uncle had married an English lady
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: of us--that unacknowledged loyalty to the early faith in kings which
title: Little Women

text: set the most democratic nation under the sun in ferment at the coming
title: Little Women

text: of a royal yellow-haired laddie, some years ago, and which still has
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: CONSEQUENCES
title: Little Women

text: Mrs. Chester's fair was so very elegant and select that it was
title: Little Women

text: considered a great honor by the young ladies of the neighborhood to be
title: Little Women

text: invited to take a table, and everyone was much interested in the
title: Little Women

text: matter.  Amy was asked, but Jo was not, which was fortunate for all
title: Little Women

text: parties, as her elbows were decidedly akimbo at this period of her
title: Little Women

text: life, and it took a good many hard knocks to teach her how to get on
title: Little Women

text: easily.  The 'haughty, uninteresting creature' was let severely alone,
title: Little Women

text: but Amy's talent and taste were duly complimented by the offer of the
title: Little Women

text: art table, and she exerted herself to prepare and secure appropriate
title: Little Women

text: and valuable contributions to it.
title: Little Women

text: Everything went on smoothly till the day before the fair opened, then
title: Little Women

text: there occurred one of the little skirmishes which it is almost
title: Little Women

text: impossible to avoid, when some five-and-twenty women, old and young,
title: Little Women

text: with all their private piques and prejudices, try to work together.
title: Little Women

text: May Chester was rather jealous of Amy because the latter was a greater
title: Little Women

text: favorite than herself, and just at this time several trifling
title: Little Women

text: circumstances occurred to increase the feeling.  Amy's dainty
title: Little Women

text: pen-and-ink work entirely eclipsed May's painted vases--that was one
title: Little Women

text: thorn.  Then the all conquering Tudor had danced four times with Amy at
title: Little Women

text: a late party and only once with May--that was thorn number two.  But
title: Little Women

text: the chief grievance that rankled in her soul, and gave an excuse for
title: Little Women

text: her unfriendly conduct, was a rumor which some obliging gossip had
title: Little Women

text: whispered to her, that the March girls had made fun of her at the
title: Little Women

text: Lambs'. All the blame of this should have fallen upon Jo, for her
title: Little Women

text: naughty imitation had been too lifelike to escape detection, and the
title: Little Women

text: frolicsome Lambs had permitted the joke to escape.  No hint of this had
title: Little Women

text: reached the culprits, however, and Amy's dismay can be imagined, when,
title: Little Women

text: the very evening before the fair, as she was putting the last touches
title: Little Women

text: to her pretty table, Mrs. Chester, who, of course, resented the
title: Little Women

text: supposed ridicule of her daughter, said, in a bland tone, but with a
title: Little Women

text: cold look...
title: Little Women

text: "I find, dear, that there is some feeling among the young ladies about
title: Little Women

text: my giving this table to anyone but my girls.  As this is the most
title: Little Women

text: prominent, and some say the most attractive table of all, and they are
title: Little Women

text: the chief getters-up of the fair, it is thought best for them to take
title: Little Women

text: this place.  I'm sorry, but I know you are too sincerely interested in
title: Little Women

text: the cause to mind a little personal disappointment, and you shall have
title: Little Women

text: another table if you like."
title: Little Women

text: Mrs. Chester fancied beforehand that it would be easy to deliver this
title: Little Women

text: little speech, but when the time came, she found it rather difficult to
title: Little Women

text: utter it naturally, with Amy's unsuspicious eyes looking straight at
title: Little Women

text: her full of surprise and trouble.
title: Little Women

text: Amy felt that there was something behind this, but could not guess
title: Little Women

text: what, and said quietly, feeling hurt, and showing that she did,
title: Little Women

text: "Perhaps you had rather I took no table at all?"
title: Little Women

text: "Now, my dear, don't have any ill feeling, I beg.  It's merely a matter
title: Little Women

text: of expediency, you see, my girls will naturally take the lead, and this
title: Little Women

text: table is considered their proper place.  I think it very appropriate to
title: Little Women

text: you, and feel very grateful for your efforts to make it so pretty, but
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: have a good place elsewhere. Wouldn't you like the flower table? The
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: charming thing of it, and the flower table is always attractive you
title: Little Women

text: know."

title: Little Women

text: as to one cause of her sudden fall from favor.  She colored angrily,
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: unexpected amiability...

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: keeps us quiet till Flo settles down to enjoy the _Flirtations of
title: Little Women

text: Captain Cavendish_, and I have the scenery all to myself.
title: Little Women

text: Of course it rained when we got to London, and there was nothing to be
title: Little Women

text: seen but fog and umbrellas.  We rested, unpacked, and shopped a little
title: Little Women

text: between the showers.  Aunt Mary got me some new things, for I came off
title: Little Women

text: in such a hurry I wasn't half ready. A white hat and blue feather, a
title: Little Women

text: muslin dress to match, and the loveliest mantle you ever saw.  Shopping
title: Little Women

text: in Regent Street is perfectly splendid.  Things seem so cheap, nice
title: Little Women

text: ribbons only sixpence a yard.  I laid in a stock, but shall get my
title: Little Women

text: gloves in Paris.  Doesn't that sound sort of elegant and rich?
title: Little Women

text: Flo and I, for the fun of it, ordered a hansom cab, while Aunt and
title: Little Women

text: Uncle were out, and went for a drive, though we learned afterward that
title: Little Women

text: it wasn't the thing for young ladies to ride in them alone.  It was so
title: Little Women

text: droll!  For when we were shut in by the wooden apron, the man drove so
title: Little Women

text: fast that Flo was frightened, and told me to stop him, but he was up
title: Little Women

text: outside behind somewhere, and I couldn't get at him.  He didn't hear me
title: Little Women

text: call, nor see me flap my parasol in front, and there we were, quite
title: Little Women

text: helpless, rattling away, and whirling around corners at a breakneck
title: Little Women

text: pace. At last, in my despair, I saw a little door in the roof, and on
title: Little Women

text: poking it open, a red eye appeared, and a beery voice said...
title: Little Women

text: "Now, then, mum?"
title: Little Women

text: I gave my order as soberly as I could, and slamming down the door, with
title: Little Women

text: an "Aye, aye, mum," the man made his horse walk, as if going to a
title: Little Women

text: funeral.  I poked again and said, "A little faster," then off he went,
title: Little Women

text: helter-skelter as before, and we resigned ourselves to our fate.
title: Little Women

text: Today was fair, and we went to Hyde Park, close by, for we are more
title: Little Women

text: aristocratic than we look.  The Duke of Devonshire lives near.  I often
title: Little Women

text: see his footmen lounging at the back gate, and the Duke of Wellington's
title: Little Women

text: house is not far off.  Such sights as I saw, my dear!  It was as good
title: Little Women

text: as Punch, for there were fat dowagers rolling about in their red and
title: Little Women

text: yellow coaches, with gorgeous Jeameses in silk stockings and velvet
title: Little Women

text: coats, up behind, and powdered coachmen in front.  Smart maids, with
title: Little Women

text: the rosiest children I ever saw, handsome girls, looking half asleep,
title: Little Women

text: dandies in queer English hats and lavender kids lounging about, and
title: Little Women

text: tall soldiers, in short red jackets and muffin caps stuck on one side,
title: Little Women

text: looking so funny I longed to sketch them.
title: Little Women

text: Rotten Row means 'Route de Roi', or the king's way, but now it's more
title: Little Women

text: like a riding school than anything else.  The horses are splendid, and
title: Little Women

text: the men, especially the grooms, ride well, but the women are stiff, and
title: Little Women

text: bounce, which isn't according to our rules.  I longed to show them a
title: Little Women

text: tearing American gallop, for they trotted solemnly up and down, in
title: Little Women

text: their scant habits and high hats, looking like the women in a toy
title: Little Women

text: Noah's Ark.  Everyone rides--old men, stout ladies, little
title: Little Women

text: children--and the young folks do a deal of flirting here, I saw a pair
title: Little Women

text: exchange rose buds, for it's the thing to wear one in the button-hole,
title: Little Women

text: and I thought it rather a nice little idea.
title: Little Women

text: In the P.M.  to Westminster Abbey, but don't expect me to describe it,
title: Little Women

text: that's impossible, so I'll only say it was sublime! This evening we are
title: Little Women

text: going to see Fechter, which will be an appropriate end to the happiest
title: Little Women

text: day of my life.
title: Little Women

text: It's very late, but I can't let my letter go in the morning without
title: Little Women

text: telling you what happened last evening.  Who do you think came in, as
title: Little Women

text: we were at tea?  Laurie's English friends, Fred and Frank Vaughn!  I
title: Little Women

text: was so surprised, for I shouldn't have known them but for the cards.
title: Little Women

text: Both are tall fellows with whiskers, Fred handsome in the English
title: Little Women

text: style, and Frank much better, for he only limps slightly, and uses no
title: Little Women

text: crutches.  They had heard from Laurie where we were to be, and came to
title: Little Women

text: ask us to their house, but Uncle won't go, so we shall return the call,
title: Little Women

text: and see them as we can.  They went to the theater with us, and we did
title: Little Women

text: have such a good time, for Frank devoted himself to Flo, and Fred and I
title: Little Women

text: talked over past, present, and future fun as if we had known each other
title: Little Women

text: all our days.  Tell Beth Frank asked for her, and was sorry to hear of
title: Little Women

text: her ill health.  Fred laughed when I spoke of Jo, and sent his
title: Little Women

text: 'respectful compliments to the big hat'. Neither of them had forgotten
title: Little Women

text: Camp Laurence, or the fun we had there.  What ages ago it seems,
title: Little Women

text: doesn't it?
title: Little Women

text: Aunt is tapping on the wall for the third time, so I must stop.  I
title: Little Women

text: really feel like a dissipated London fine lady, writing here so late,
title: Little Women

text: with my room full of pretty things, and my head a jumble of parks,
title: Little Women

text: theaters, new gowns, and gallant creatures who say "Ah!" and twirl
title: Little Women

text: their blond mustaches with the true English lordliness.  I long to see
title: Little Women

text: you all, and in spite of my nonsense am, as ever, your loving...
title: Little Women

text: AMY
title: Little Women

text: PARIS
title: Little Women

text: Dear girls,
title: Little Women

text: In my last I told you about our London visit, how kind the Vaughns
title: Little Women

text: were, and what pleasant parties they made for us.  I enjoyed the trips
title: Little Women

text: to Hampton Court and the Kensington Museum more than anything else, for
title: Little Women

text: at Hampton I saw Raphael's cartoons, and at the Museum, rooms full of
title: Little Women

text: pictures by Turner, Lawrence, Reynolds, Hogarth, and the other great
title: Little Women

text: creatures.  The day in Richmond Park was charming, for we had a regular
title: Little Women

text: English picnic, and I had more splendid oaks and groups of deer than I
title: Little Women

text: could copy, also heard a nightingale, and saw larks go up.  We 'did'
title: Little Women

text: London to our heart's content, thanks to Fred and Frank, and were sorry
title: Little Women

text: to go away, for though English people are slow to take you in, when
title: Little Women

text: they once make up their minds to do it they cannot be outdone in
title: Little Women

text: hospitality, I think.  The Vaughns hope to meet us in Rome next winter,
title: Little Women

text: and I shall be dreadfully disappointed if they don't, for Grace and I
title: Little Women

text: are great friends, and the boys very nice fellows, especially Fred.
title: Little Women

text: Well, we were hardly settled here, when he turned up again, saying he
title: Little Women

text: had come for a holiday, and was going to Switzerland. Aunt looked sober
title: Little Women

text: at first, but he was so cool about it she couldn't say a word.  And now
title: Little Women

text: we get on nicely, and are very glad he came, for he speaks French like
title: Little Women

text: a native, and I don't know what we should do without him.  Uncle
title: Little Women

text: doesn't know ten words, and insists on talking English very loud, as if
title: Little Women

text: it would make people understand him.  Aunt's pronunciation is
title: Little Women

text: old-fashioned, and Flo and I, though we flattered ourselves that we
title: Little Women

text: knew a good deal, find we don't, and are very grateful to have Fred do
title: Little Women

text: the '_parley vooing_', as Uncle calls it.
title: Little Women

text: Such delightful times as we are having!  Sight-seeing from morning till
title: Little Women

text: night, stopping for nice lunches in the gay _cafes_, and meeting with
title: Little Women

text: all sorts of droll adventures.  Rainy days I spend in the Louvre,
title: Little Women

text: revelling in pictures.  Jo would turn up her naughty nose at some of
title: Little Women

text: the finest, because she has no soul for art, but I have, and I'm
title: Little Women

text: cultivating eye and taste as fast as I can.  She would like the relics
title: Little Women

text: of great people better, for I've seen her Napoleon's cocked hat and
title: Little Women

text: gray coat, his baby's cradle and his old toothbrush, also Marie
title: Little Women

text: Antoinette's little shoe, the ring of Saint Denis, Charlemagne's sword,
title: Little Women

text: and many other interesting things.  I'll talk for hours about them when
title: Little Women

text: I come, but haven't time to write.
title: Little Women

text: The Palais Royale is a heavenly place, so full of _bijouterie_ and
title: Little Women

text: lovely things that I'm nearly distracted because I can't buy them.
title: Little Women

text: Fred wanted to get me some, but of course I didn't allow it.  Then the
title: Little Women

text: Bois and Champs Elysees are _tres magnifique_. I've seen the imperial
title: Little Women

text: family several times, the emperor an ugly, hard-looking man, the
title: Little Women

text: empress pale and pretty, but dressed in bad taste, I thought--purple
title: Little Women

text: dress, green hat, and yellow gloves. Little Nap is a handsome boy, who
title: Little Women

text: sits chatting to his tutor, and kisses his hand to the people as he
title: Little Women

text: passes in his four-horse barouche, with postilions in red satin jackets
title: Little Women

text: and a mounted guard before and behind.
title: Little Women

text: We often walk in the Tuileries Gardens, for they are lovely, though the
title: Little Women

text: antique Luxembourg Gardens suit me better. Pere la Chaise is very
title: Little Women

text: curious, for many of the tombs are like small rooms, and looking in,
title: Little Women

text: one sees a table, with images or pictures of the dead, and chairs for
title: Little Women

text: the mourners to sit in when they come to lament.  That is so Frenchy.
title: Little Women

text: Our rooms are on the Rue de Rivoli, and sitting on the balcony, we look
title: Little Women

text: up and down the long, brilliant street.  It is so pleasant that we
title: Little Women

text: spend our evenings talking there when too tired with our day's work to
title: Little Women

text: go out.  Fred is very entertaining, and is altogether the most
title: Little Women

text: agreeable young man I ever knew--except Laurie, whose manners are more
title: Little Women

text: charming.  I wish Fred was dark, for I don't fancy light men, however,
title: Little Women

text: the Vaughns are very rich and come of an excellent family, so I won't
title: Little Women

text: find fault with their yellow hair, as my own is yellower.
title: Little Women

text: Next week we are off to Germany and Switzerland, and as we shall travel
title: Little Women

text: fast, I shall only be able to give you hasty letters.  I keep my diary,
title: Little Women

text: and try to 'remember correctly and describe clearly all that I see and
title: Little Women

text: admire', as Father advised. It is good practice for me, and with my
title: Little Women

text: sketchbook will give you a better idea of my tour than these scribbles.
title: Little Women

text: Adieu, I embrace you tenderly. _"Votre Amie."_
title: Little Women

text: HEIDELBERG
title: Little Women

text: My dear Mamma,
title: Little Women

text: Having a quiet hour before we leave for Berne, I'll try to tell you
title: Little Women

text: what has happened, for some of it is very important, as you will see.
title: Little Women

text: The sail up the Rhine was perfect, and I just sat and enjoyed it with
title: Little Women

text: all my might.  Get Father's old guidebooks and read about it.  I
title: Little Women

text: haven't words beautiful enough to describe it. At Coblentz we had a
title: Little Women

text: lovely time, for some students from Bonn, with whom Fred got acquainted
title: Little Women

text: on the boat, gave us a serenade. It was a moonlight night, and about
title: Little Women

text: one o'clock Flo and I were waked by the most delicious music under our
title: Little Women

text: windows.  We flew up, and hid behind the curtains, but sly peeps showed
title: Little Women

text: us Fred and the students singing away down below.  It was the most
title: Little Women

text: romantic thing I ever saw--the river, the bridge of boats, the great
title: Little Women

text: fortress opposite, moonlight everywhere, and music fit to melt a heart
title: Little Women

text: of stone.
title: Little Women

text: When they were done we threw down some flowers, and saw them scramble
title: Little Women

text: for them, kiss their hands to the invisible ladies, and go laughing
title: Little Women

text: away, to smoke and drink beer, I suppose.  Next morning Fred showed me
title: Little Women

text: one of the crumpled flowers in his vest pocket, and looked very
title: Little Women

text: sentimental.  I laughed at him, and said I didn't throw it, but Flo,
title: Little Women

text: which seemed to disgust him, for he tossed it out of the window, and
title: Little Women

text: turned sensible again.  I'm afraid I'm going to have trouble with that
title: Little Women

text: boy, it begins to look like it.
title: Little Women

text: The baths at Nassau were very gay, so was Baden-Baden, where Fred lost
title: Little Women

text: some money, and I scolded him.  He needs someone to look after him when
title: Little Women

text: Frank is not with him.  Kate said once she hoped he'd marry soon, and I
title: Little Women

text: quite agree with her that it would be well for him.  Frankfurt was
title: Little Women

text: delightful.  I saw Goethe's house, Schiller's statue, and Dannecker's
title: Little Women

text: famous 'Ariadne.'  It was very lovely, but I should have enjoyed it
title: Little Women

text: more if I had known the story better.  I didn't like to ask, as
title: Little Women

text: everyone knew it or pretended they did.  I wish Jo would tell me all
title: Little Women

text: about it.  I ought to have read more, for I find I don't know anything,
title: Little Women

text: and it mortifies me.
title: Little Women

text: Now comes the serious part, for it happened here, and Fred has just
title: Little Women

text: gone.  He has been so kind and jolly that we all got quite fond of him.
title: Little Women

text: I never thought of anything but a traveling friendship till the
title: Little Women

text: serenade night.  Since then I've begun to feel that the moonlight
title: Little Women

text: walks, balcony talks, and daily adventures were something more to him
title: Little Women

text: than fun.  I haven't flirted, Mother, truly, but remembered what you
title: Little Women

text: said to me, and have done my very best.  I can't help it if people like
title: Little Women

text: me.  I don't try to make them, and it worries me if I don't care for
title: Little Women

text: them, though Jo says I haven't got any heart.  Now I know Mother will
title: Little Women

text: shake her head, and the girls say, "Oh, the mercenary little wretch!",
title: Little Women

text: but I've made up my mind, and if Fred asks me, I shall accept him,
title: Little Women

text: though I'm not madly in love.  I like him, and we get on comfortably
title: Little Women

text: together.  He is handsome, young, clever enough, and very rich--ever so
title: Little Women

text: much richer than the Laurences.  I don't think his family would object,
title: Little Women

text: and I should be very happy, for they are all kind, well-bred, generous
title: Little Women

text: people, and they like me.  Fred, as the eldest twin, will have the
title: Little Women

text: estate, I suppose, and such a splendid one it is!  A city house in a
title: Little Women

text: fashionable street, not so showy as our big houses, but twice as
title: Little Women

text: comfortable and full of solid luxury, such as English people believe
title: Little Women

text: in.  I like it, for it's genuine.  I've seen the plate, the family
title: Little Women

text: jewels, the old servants, and pictures of the country place, with its
title: Little Women

text: park, great house, lovely grounds, and fine horses.  Oh, it would be
title: Little Women

text: all I should ask!  And I'd rather have it than any title such as girls
title: Little Women

text: snap up so readily, and find nothing behind.  I may be mercenary, but I
title: Little Women

text: hate poverty, and don't mean to bear it a minute longer than I can
title: Little Women

text: help.  One of us _must_ marry well.  Meg didn't, Jo won't, Beth can't
title: Little Women

text: yet, so I shall, and make everything okay all round.  I wouldn't marry
title: Little Women

text: a man I hated or despised.  You may be sure of that, and though Fred is
title: Little Women

text: not my model hero, he does very well, and in time I should get fond
title: Little Women

text: enough of him if he was very fond of me, and let me do just as I liked.
title: Little Women

text: So I've been turning the matter over in my mind the last week, for it
title: Little Women

text: was impossible to help seeing that Fred liked me.  He said nothing, but
title: Little Women

text: little things showed it.  He never goes with Flo, always gets on my
title: Little Women

text: side of the carriage, table, or promenade, looks sentimental when we
title: Little Women

text: are alone, and frowns at anyone else who ventures to speak to me.
title: Little Women

text: Yesterday at dinner, when an Austrian officer stared at us and then
title: Little Women

text: said something to his friend, a rakish-looking baron, about '_ein
title: Little Women

text: wonderschones Blondchen'_, Fred looked as fierce as a lion, and cut his
title: Little Women

text: meat so savagely it nearly flew off his plate.  He isn't one of the
title: Little Women

text: cool, stiff Englishmen, but is rather peppery, for he has Scotch blood
title: Little Women

text: in him, as one might guess from his bonnie blue eyes.
title: Little Women

text: Well, last evening we went up to the castle about sunset, at least all
title: Little Women

text: of us but Fred, who was to meet us there after going to the Post
title: Little Women

text: Restante for letters.  We had a charming time poking about the ruins,
title: Little Women

text: the vaults where the monster tun is, and the beautiful gardens made by
title: Little Women

text: the elector long ago for his English wife.  I liked the great terrace
title: Little Women

text: best, for the view was divine, so while the rest went to see the rooms
title: Little Women

text: inside, I sat there trying to sketch the gray stone lion's head on the
title: Little Women

text: wall, with scarlet woodbine sprays hanging round it.  I felt as if I'd
title: Little Women

text: got into a romance, sitting there, watching the Neckar rolling through
title: Little Women

text: the valley, listening to the music of the Austrian band below, and
title: Little Women

text: waiting for my lover, like a real storybook girl.  I had a feeling that
title: Little Women

text: something was going to happen and I was ready for it.  I didn't feel
title: Little Women

text: blushy or quakey, but quite cool and only a little excited.
title: Little Women

text: By-and-by I heard Fred's voice, and then he came hurrying through the
title: Little Women

text: great arch to find me.  He looked so troubled that I forgot all about
title: Little Women

text: myself, and asked what the matter was.  He said he'd just got a letter
title: Little Women

text: begging him to come home, for Frank was very ill.  So he was going at
title: Little Women

text: once on the night train and only had time to say good-by.  I was very
title: Little Women

text: sorry for him, and disappointed for myself, but only for a minute
title: Little Women

text: because he said, as he shook hands, and said it in a way that I could
title: Little Women

text: not mistake,  "I shall soon come back, you won't forget me, Amy?"
title: Little Women

text: I didn't promise, but I looked at him, and he seemed satisfied, and
title: Little Women

text: there was no time for anything but messages and good-byes, for he was
title: Little Women

text: off in an hour, and we all miss him very much. I know he wanted to
title: Little Women

text: speak, but I think, from something he once hinted, that he had promised
title: Little Women

text: his father not to do anything of the sort yet a while, for he is a rash
title: Little Women

text: boy, and the old gentleman dreads a foreign daughter-in-law.  We shall
title: Little Women

text: soon meet in Rome, and then, if I don't change my mind, I'll say "Yes,
title: Little Women

text: thank you," when he says "Will you, please?"
title: Little Women

text: Of course this is all _very private_, but I wished you to know what was
title: Little Women

text: going on.  Don't be anxious about me, remember I am your 'prudent Amy',
title: Little Women

text: and be sure I will do nothing rashly. Send me as much advice as you
title: Little Women

text: like.  I'll use it if I can.  I wish I could see you for a good talk,
title: Little Women

text: Marmee.  Love and trust me.
title: Little Women

text: Ever your AMY

text: CHAPTER THIRTY-TWO
title: Little Women

text: TENDER TROUBLES
title: Little Women

text: "Jo, I'm anxious about Beth."
title: Little Women

text: "Why, Mother, she has seemed unusually well since the babies came."
title: Little Women

text: "It's not her health that troubles me now, it's her spirits. I'm sure
title: Little Women

text: there is something on her mind, and I want you to discover what it is."
title: Little Women

text: "What makes you think so, Mother?"
title: Little Women

text: "She sits alone a good deal, and doesn't talk to her father as much as
title: Little Women

text: she used.  I found her crying over the babies the other day.  When she
title: Little Women

text: sings, the songs are always sad ones, and now and then I see a look in
title: Little Women

text: her face that I don't understand. This isn't like Beth, and it worries
title: Little Women

text: me."
title: Little Women

text: "Have you asked her about it?"
title: Little Women

text: "I have tried once or twice, but she either evaded my questions or
title: Little Women

text: looked so distressed that I stopped.  I never force my children's
title: Little Women

text: confidence, and I seldom have to wait for long."
title: Little Women

text: Mrs. March glanced at Jo as she spoke, but the face opposite seemed
title: Little Women

text: quite unconscious of any secret disquietude but Beth's, and after
title: Little Women

text: sewing thoughtfully for a minute, Jo said, "I think she is growing up,
title: Little Women

text: and so begins to dream dreams, and have hopes and fears and fidgets,
title: Little Women

text: without knowing why or being able to explain them.  Why, Mother, Beth's
title: Little Women

text: eighteen, but we don't realize it, and treat her like a child,
title: Little Women

text: forgetting she's a woman."
title: Little Women

text: "So she is.  Dear heart, how fast you do grow up," returned her mother
title: Little Women

text: with a sigh and a smile.
title: Little Women

text: "Can't be helped, Marmee, so you must resign yourself to all sorts of
title: Little Women

text: worries, and let your birds hop out of the nest, one by one.  I promise
title: Little Women

text: never to hop very far, if that is any comfort to you."
title: Little Women

text: "It's a great comfort, Jo.  I always feel strong when you are at home,
title: Little Women

text: now Meg is gone.  Beth is too feeble and Amy too young to depend upon,
title: Little Women

text: but when the tug comes, you are always ready."
title: Little Women

text: "Why, you know I don't mind hard jobs much, and there must always be
title: Little Women

text: one scrub in a family.  Amy is splendid in fine works and I'm not, but
title: Little Women

text: I feel in my element when all the carpets are to be taken up, or half
title: Little Women

text: the family fall sick at once. Amy is distinguishing herself abroad, but
title: Little Women

text: if anything is amiss at home, I'm your man."
title: Little Women

text: "I leave Beth to your hands, then, for she will open her tender little
title: Little Women

text: heart to her Jo sooner than to anyone else.  Be very kind, and don't
title: Little Women

text: let her think anyone watches or talks about her.  If she only would get
title: Little Women

text: quite strong and cheerful again, I shouldn't have a wish in the world."
title: Little Women

text: "Happy woman!  I've got heaps."
title: Little Women

text: "My dear, what are they?"
title: Little Women

text: "I'll settle Bethy's troubles, and then I'll tell you mine. They are
title: Little Women

text: not very wearing, so they'll keep." and Jo stitched away, with a wise
title: Little Women

text: nod which set her mother's heart at rest about her for the present at
title: Little Women

text: least.
title: Little Women

text: While apparently absorbed in her own affairs, Jo watched Beth, and
title: Little Women

text: after many conflicting conjectures, finally settled upon one which
title: Little Women

text: seemed to explain the change in her.  A slight incident gave Jo the
title: Little Women

text: clue to the mystery, she thought, and lively fancy, loving heart did
title: Little Women

text: the rest.  She was affecting to write busily one Saturday afternoon,
title: Little Women

text: when she and Beth were alone together.  Yet as she scribbled, she kept
title: Little Women

text: her eye on her sister, who seemed unusually quiet.  Sitting at the
title: Little Women

text: window, Beth's work often dropped into her lap, and she leaned her head
title: Little Women

text: upon her hand, in a dejected attitude, while her eyes rested on the
title: Little Women

text: dull, autumnal landscape.  Suddenly some one passed below, whistling
title: Little Women

text: like an operatic blackbird, and a voice called out, "All serene! Coming
title: Little Women

text: in tonight."
title: Little Women

text: Beth started, leaned forward, smiled and nodded, watched the passer-by
title: Little Women

text: till his quick tramp died away, then said softly as if to herself, "How
title: Little Women

text: strong and well and happy that dear boy looks."
title: Little Women

text: "Hum!" said Jo, still intent upon her sister's face, for the bright
title: Little Women

text: color faded as quickly as it came, the smile vanished, and presently a
title: Little Women

text: tear lay shining on the window ledge.  Beth whisked it off, and in her
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: Had a lively time in my seminary this morning, for the children acted
title: Little Women

text: like Sancho, and at one time I really thought I should shake them all
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: Thursday
title: Little Women

text: Yesterday was a quiet day spent in teaching, sewing, and writing in my
title: Little Women

text: little room, which is very cozy, with a light and fire.  I picked up a
title: Little Women

text: few bits of news and was introduced to the Professor.  It seems that
title: Little Women

text: Tina is the child of the Frenchwoman who does the fine ironing in the
title: Little Women

text: laundry here.  The little thing has lost her heart to Mr. Bhaer, and
title: Little Women

text: follows him about the house like a dog whenever he is at home, which
title: Little Women

text: delights him, as he is very fond of children, though a 'bacheldore'.
title: Little Women

text: Kitty and Minnie Kirke likewise regard him with affection, and tell all
title: Little Women

text: sorts of stories about the plays he invents, the presents he brings,
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: call him Old Fritz, Lager Beer, Ursa Major, and make all manner of
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: foreign ways.
title: Little Women

text: The maiden lady is a Miss Norton, rich, cultivated, and kind.  She
title: Little Women

text: spoke to me at dinner today (for I went to table again, it's such fun
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: friendly, so I shall make myself agreeable, for I do want to get into
title: Little Women

text: good society, only it isn't the same sort that Amy likes.
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: Nothing has happened to write about, except a call on Miss Norton, who
title: Little Women

text: has a room full of pretty things, and who was very charming, for she
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: JANUARY
title: Little Women

text: A Happy New Year to you all, my dearest family, which of course
title: Little Women

text: includes Mr. L.  and a young man by the name of Teddy. I can't tell you
title: Little Women

text: how much I enjoyed your Christmas bundle, for I didn't get it till
title: Little Women

text: night and had given up hoping.  Your letter came in the morning, but
title: Little Women

text: you said nothing about a parcel, meaning it for a surprise, so I was
title: Little Women

text: disappointed, for I'd had a 'kind of feeling' that you wouldn't forget
title: Little Women

text: me. I felt a little low in my mind as I sat up in my room after tea,
title: Little Women

text: and when the big, muddy, battered-looking bundle was brought to me, I
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: Speaking of books reminds me that I'm getting rich in that line, for on
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: FRIEND
title: Little Women

text: Though very happy in the social atmosphere about her, and very busy
title: Little Women

text: with the daily work that earned her bread and made it sweeter for the
title: Little Women

text: effort, Jo still found time for literary labors.  The purpose which now
title: Little Women

text: took possession of her was a natural one to a poor and ambitious girl,
title: Little Women

text: but the means she took to gain her end were not the best.  She saw that
title: Little Women

text: money conferred power, money and power, therefore, she resolved to
title: Little Women

text: have, not to be used for herself alone, but for those whom she loved
title: Little Women

text: more than life.  The dream of filling home with comforts, giving Beth
title: Little Women

text: everything she wanted, from strawberries in winter to an organ in her
title: Little Women

text: bedroom, going abroad herself, and always having more than enough, so
title: Little Women

text: that she might indulge in the luxury of charity, had been for years
title: Little Women

text: Jo's most cherished castle in the air.

text: The prize-story experience had seemed to open a way which might, after
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: BETH'S SECRET
title: Little Women

text: When Jo came home that spring, she had been struck with the change in
title: Little Women

text: Beth.  No one spoke of it or seemed aware of it, for it had come too
title: Little Women

text: gradually to startle those who saw her daily, but to eyes sharpened by
title: Little Women

text: absence, it was very plain and a heavy weight fell on Jo's heart as she
title: Little Women

text: saw her sister's face. It was no paler and but littler thinner than in
title: Little Women

text: the autumn, yet there was a strange, transparent look about it, as if
title: Little Women

text: the mortal was being slowly refined away, and the immortal shining
title: Little Women

text: through the frail flesh with an indescribably pathetic beauty.  Jo saw
title: Little Women

text: and felt it, but said nothing at the time, and soon the first
title: Little Women

text: impression lost much of its power, for Beth seemed happy, no one
title: Little Women

text: appeared to doubt that she was better, and presently in other cares Jo
title: Little Women

text: for a time forgot her fear.

text: But when Laurie was gone, and peace prevailed again, the vague anxiety
title: Little Women

text: returned and haunted her.  She had confessed her sins and been
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women
