text: went, quite unconscious of the interest they excited in those about
title: Little Women

text: them, who watched with sympathetic eyes the strong sister and the
title: Little Women

text: feeble one, always together, as if they felt instinctively that a long
title: Little Women

text: separation was not far away.
title: Little Women

text: They did feel it, yet neither spoke of it, for often between ourselves
title: Little Women

text: and those nearest and dearest to us there exists a reserve which it is
title: Little Women

text: very hard to overcome.  Jo felt as if a veil had fallen between her
title: Little Women

text: heart and Beth's, but when she put out her hand to lift it up, there
title: Little Women

text: seemed something sacred in the silence, and she waited for Beth to
title: Little Women

text: speak.  She wondered, and was thankful also, that her parents did not
title: Little Women

text: seem to see what she saw, and during the quiet weeks when the shadows
title: Little Women

text: grew so plain to her, she said nothing of it to those at home,
title: Little Women

text: believing that it would tell itself when Beth came back no better. She
title: Little Women

text: wondered still more if her sister really guessed the hard truth, and
title: Little Women

text: what thoughts were passing through her mind during the long hours when
title: Little Women

text: she lay on the warm rocks with her head in Jo's lap, while the winds
title: Little Women

text: blew healthfully over her and the sea made music at her feet.
title: Little Women

text: One day Beth told her.  Jo thought she was asleep, she lay so still,
title: Little Women

text: and putting down her book, sat looking at her with wistful eyes, trying
title: Little Women

text: to see signs of hope in the faint color on Beth's cheeks.  But she
title: Little Women

text: could not find enough to satisfy her, for the cheeks were very thin,
title: Little Women

text: and the hands seemed too feeble to hold even the rosy little shells
title: Little Women

text: they had been collecting. It came to her then more bitterly than ever
title: Little Women

text: that Beth was slowly drifting away from her, and her arms instinctively
title: Little Women

text: tightened their hold upon the dearest treasure she possessed. For a
title: Little Women

text: minute her eyes were too dim for seeing, and when they cleared, Beth
title: Little Women

text: was looking up at her so tenderly that there was hardly any need for
title: Little Women

text: her to say, "Jo, dear, I'm glad you know it.  I've tried to tell you,
title: Little Women

text: but I couldn't."
title: Little Women

text: There was no answer except her sister's cheek against her own, not even
title: Little Women

text: tears, for when most deeply moved, Jo did not cry.  She was the weaker
title: Little Women

text: then, and Beth tried to comfort and sustain her, with her arms about
title: Little Women

text: her and the soothing words she whispered in her ear.
title: Little Women

text: "I've known it for a good while, dear, and now I'm used to it, it isn't
title: Little Women

text: hard to think of or to bear.  Try to see it so and don't be troubled
title: Little Women

text: about me, because it's best, indeed it is."
title: Little Women

text: "Is this what made you so unhappy in the autumn, Beth? You did not feel
title: Little Women

text: it then, and keep it to yourself so long, did you?" asked Jo, refusing
title: Little Women

text: to see or say that it was best, but glad to know that Laurie had no
title: Little Women

text: part in Beth's trouble.
title: Little Women

text: "Yes, I gave up hoping then, but I didn't like to own it. I tried to
title: Little Women

text: think it was a sick fancy, and would not let it trouble anyone.  But
title: Little Women

text: when I saw you all so well and strong and full of happy plans, it was
title: Little Women

text: hard to feel that I could never be like you, and then I was miserable,
title: Little Women

text: Jo."
title: Little Women

text: "Oh, Beth, and you didn't tell me, didn't let me comfort and help you?
title: Little Women

text: How could you shut me out, bear it all alone?"
title: Little Women

text: Jo's voice was full of tender reproach, and her heart ached to think of
title: Little Women

text: the solitary struggle that must have gone on while Beth learned to say
title: Little Women

text: goodbye to health, love, and life, and take up her cross so cheerfully.
title: Little Women

text: "Perhaps it was wrong, but I tried to do right.  I wasn't sure, no one
title: Little Women

text: said anything, and I hoped I was mistaken.  It would have been selfish
title: Little Women

text: to frighten you all when Marmee was so anxious about Meg, and Amy away,
title: Little Women

text: and you so happy with Laurie--at least I thought so then."
title: Little Women

text: "And I thought you loved him, Beth, and I went away because I
title: Little Women

text: couldn't," cried Jo, glad to say all the truth.
title: Little Women

text: Beth looked so amazed at the idea that Jo smiled in spite of her pain,
title: Little Women

text: and added softly, "Then you didn't, dearie? I was afraid it was so, and
title: Little Women

text: imagined your poor little heart full of lovelornity all that while."
title: Little Women

text: "Why, Jo, how could I, when he was so fond of you?" asked Beth, as
title: Little Women

text: innocently as a child.  "I do love him dearly.  He is so good to me,
title: Little Women

text: how can I help It?  But he could never be anything to me but my
title: Little Women

text: brother.  I hope he truly will be, sometime."
title: Little Women

text: "Not through me," said Jo decidedly.  "Amy is left for him, and they
title: Little Women

text: would suit excellently, but I have no heart for such things, now.  I
title: Little Women

text: don't care what becomes of anybody but you, Beth. You must get well."
title: Little Women

text: "I want to, oh, so much!  I try, but every day I lose a little, and
title: Little Women

text: feel more sure that I shall never gain it back.  It's like the tide,
title: Little Women

text: Jo, when it turns, it goes slowly, but it can't be stopped."
title: Little Women

text: "It shall be stopped, your tide must not turn so soon, nineteen is too
title: Little Women

text: young, Beth.  I can't let you go.  I'll work and pray and fight against
title: Little Women

text: it.  I'll keep you in spite of everything.  There must be ways, it
title: Little Women

text: can't be too late.  God won't be so cruel as to take you from me,"
title: Little Women

text: cried poor Jo rebelliously, for her spirit was far less piously
title: Little Women

text: submissive than Beth's.
title: Little Women

text: Simple, sincere people seldom speak much of their piety.  It shows
title: Little Women

text: itself in acts rather than in words, and has more influence than
title: Little Women

text: homilies or protestations.  Beth could not reason upon or explain the
title: Little Women

text: faith that gave her courage and patience to give up life, and
title: Little Women

text: cheerfully wait for death.  Like a confiding child, she asked no
title: Little Women

text: questions, but left everything to God and nature, Father and Mother of
title: Little Women

text: us all, feeling sure that they, and they only, could teach and
title: Little Women

text: strengthen heart and spirit for this life and the life to come.  She
title: Little Women

text: did not rebuke Jo with saintly speeches, only loved her better for her
title: Little Women

text: passionate affection, and clung more closely to the dear human love,
title: Little Women

text: from which our Father never means us to be weaned, but through which He
title: Little Women

text: draws us closer to Himself.  She could not say, "I'm glad to go," for
title: Little Women

text: life was very sweet for her.  She could only sob out, "I try to be
title: Little Women

text: willing," while she held fast to Jo, as the first bitter wave of this
title: Little Women

text: great sorrow broke over them together.
title: Little Women

text: By and by Beth said, with recovered serenity, "You'll tell them this
title: Little Women

text: when we go home?"
title: Little Women

text: "I think they will see it without words," sighed Jo, for now it seemed
title: Little Women

text: to her that Beth changed every day.
title: Little Women

text: "Perhaps not.  I've heard that the people who love best are often
title: Little Women

text: blindest to such things.  If they don't see it, you will tell them for
title: Little Women

text: me.  I don't want any secrets, and it's kinder to prepare them.  Meg
title: Little Women

text: has John and the babies to comfort her, but you must stand by Father
title: Little Women

text: and Mother, won't you Jo?"
title: Little Women

text: "If I can.  But, Beth, I don't give up yet.  I'm going to believe that
title: Little Women

text: it is a sick fancy, and not let you think it's true." said Jo, trying
title: Little Women

text: to speak cheerfully.
title: Little Women

text: Beth lay a minute thinking, and then said in her quiet way, "I don't
title: Little Women

text: know how to express myself, and shouldn't try to anyone but you,
title: Little Women

text: because I can't speak out except to my Jo.  I only mean to say that I
title: Little Women

text: have a feeling that it never was intended I should live long.  I'm not
title: Little Women

text: like the rest of you.  I never made any plans about what I'd do when I
title: Little Women

text: grew up.  I never thought of being married, as you all did.  I couldn't
title: Little Women

text: seem to imagine myself anything but stupid little Beth, trotting about
title: Little Women

text: at home, of no use anywhere but there.  I never wanted to go away, and
title: Little Women

text: the hard part now is the leaving you all.  I'm not afraid, but it seems
title: Little Women

text: as if I should be homesick for you even in heaven."
title: Little Women

text: Jo could not speak, and for several minutes there was no sound but the
title: Little Women

text: sigh of the wind and the lapping of the tide.  A white-winged gull flew
title: Little Women

text: by, with the flash of sunshine on its silvery breast.  Beth watched it
title: Little Women

text: till it vanished, and her eyes were full of sadness.  A little
title: Little Women

text: gray-coated sand bird came tripping over the beach 'peeping' softly to
title: Little Women

text: itself, as if enjoying the sun and sea.  It came quite close to Beth,
title: Little Women

text: and looked at her with a friendly eye and sat upon a warm stone,
title: Little Women

text: dressing its wet feathers, quite at home.  Beth smiled and felt
title: Little Women

text: comforted, for the tiny thing seemed to offer its small friendship and
title: Little Women

text: remind her that a pleasant world was still to be enjoyed.
title: Little Women

text: "Dear little bird!  See, Jo, how tame it is.  I like peeps better than
title: Little Women

text: the gulls.  They are not so wild and handsome, but they seem happy,
title: Little Women

text: confiding little things.  I used to call them my birds last summer, and
title: Little Women

text: Mother said they reminded her of me--busy, quaker-colored creatures,
title: Little Women

text: always near the shore, and always chirping that contented little song
title: Little Women

text: of theirs.  You are the gull, Jo, strong and wild, fond of the storm
title: Little Women

text: and the wind, flying far out to sea, and happy all alone.  Meg is the
title: Little Women

text: turtledove, and Amy is like the lark she writes about, trying to get up
title: Little Women

text: among the clouds, but always dropping down into its nest again.  Dear
title: Little Women

text: little girl!  She's so ambitious, but her heart is good and tender, and
title: Little Women

text: no matter how high she flies, she never will forget home.  I hope I
title: Little Women

text: shall see her again, but she seems so far away."
title: Little Women

text: "She is coming in the spring, and I mean that you shall be all ready to
title: Little Women

text: see and enjoy her.  I'm going to have you well and rosy by that time,"
title: Little Women

text: began Jo, feeling that of all the changes in Beth, the talking change
title: Little Women

text: was the greatest, for it seemed to cost no effort now, and she thought
title: Little Women

text: aloud in a way quite unlike bashful Beth.
title: Little Women

text: "Jo, dear, don't hope any more.  It won't do any good.  I'm sure of
title: Little Women

text: that.  We won't be miserable, but enjoy being together while we wait.
title: Little Women

text: We'll have happy times, for I don't suffer much, and I think the tide
title: Little Women

text: will go out easily, if you help me."
title: Little Women

text: Jo leaned down to kiss the tranquil face, and with that silent kiss,
title: Little Women

text: she dedicated herself soul and body to Beth.
title: Little Women

text: She was right.  There was no need of any words when they got home, for
title: Little Women

text: Father and Mother saw plainly now what they had prayed to be saved from
title: Little Women

text: seeing.  Tired with her short journey, Beth went at once to bed, saying
title: Little Women

text: how glad she was to be home, and when Jo went down, she found that she
title: Little Women

text: would be spared the hard task of telling Beth's secret.  Her father
title: Little Women

text: stood leaning his head on the mantelpiece and did not turn as she came
title: Little Women

text: in, but her mother stretched out her arms as if for help, and Jo went
title: Little Women

text: to comfort her without a word.

text: At three o'clock in the afternoon, all the fashionable world at Nice
title: Little Women

text: may be seen on the Promenade des Anglais--a charming place, for the
title: Little Women

text: wide walk, bordered with palms, flowers, and tropical shrubs, is
title: Little Women

text: bounded on one side by the sea, on the other by the grand drive, lined
title: Little Women

text: with hotels and villas, while beyond lie orange orchards and the hills.
title: Little Women

text: Many nations are represented, many languages spoken, many costumes
title: Little Women

text: worn, and on a sunny day the spectacle is as gay and brilliant as a
title: Little Women

text: carnival.  Haughty English, lively French, sober Germans, handsome
title: Little Women

text: Spaniards, ugly Russians, meek Jews, free-and-easy Americans, all
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: Along this walk, on Christmas Day, a tall young man walked slowly, with
title: Little Women

text: his hands behind him, and a somewhat absent expression of countenance.
title: Little Women

text: He looked like an Italian, was dressed like an Englishman, and had the
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: him his inches. There were plenty of pretty faces to admire, but the
title: Little Women

text: young man took little notice of them, except to glance now and then at
title: Little Women

text: some blonde girl in blue.  Presently he strolled out of the promenade
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: In France the young girls have a dull time of it till they are married,

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: the little cares and duties that affect us all, and I try not to let
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: LAZY LAURENCE
title: Little Women

text: Laurie went to Nice intending to stay a week, and remained a month.  He
title: Little Women

text: was tired of wandering about alone, and Amy's familiar presence seemed
title: Little Women

text: to give a homelike charm to the foreign scenes in which she bore a
title: Little Women

text: part.  He rather missed the 'petting' he used to receive, and enjoyed a
title: Little Women

text: taste of it again, for no attentions, however flattering, from
title: Little Women

text: strangers, were half so pleasant as the sisterly adoration of the girls
title: Little Women

text: at home.  Amy never would pet him like the others, but she was very
title: Little Women

text: glad to see him now, and quite clung to him, feeling that he was the
title: Little Women

text: representative of the dear family for whom she longed more than she
title: Little Women

text: would confess.  They naturally took comfort in each other's society and
title: Little Women

text: were much together, riding, walking, dancing, or dawdling, for at Nice
title: Little Women

text: no one can be very industrious during the gay season.  But, while
title: Little Women

text: apparently amusing themselves in the most careless fashion, they were
title: Little Women

text: half-consciously making discoveries and forming opinions about each
title: Little Women

text: other.  Amy rose daily in the estimation of her friend, but he sank in
title: Little Women

text: hers, and each felt the truth before a word was spoken.  Amy tried to
title: Little Women

text: please, and succeeded, for she was grateful for the many pleasures he
title: Little Women

text: gave her, and repaid him with the little services to which womanly
title: Little Women

text: women know how to lend an indescribable charm.  Laurie made no effort
title: Little Women

text: of any kind, but just let himself drift along as comfortably as
title: Little Women

text: possible, trying to forget, and feeling that all women owed him a kind
title: Little Women

text: word because one had been cold to him.  It cost him no effort to be
title: Little Women

text: generous, and he would have given Amy all the trinkets in Nice if she
title: Little Women

text: would have taken them, but at the same time he felt that he could not
title: Little Women

text: DAISY AND DEMI
title: Little Women

text: I cannot feel that I have done my duty as humble historian of the March
title: Little Women

text: family, without devoting at least one chapter to the two most precious
title: Little Women

text: and important members of it.  Daisy and Demi had now arrived at years
title: Little Women

text: of discretion, for in this fast age babies of three or four assert
title: Little Women

text: their rights, and get them, too, which is more than many of their
title: Little Women

text: elders do.  If there ever were a pair of twins in danger of being
title: Little Women

text: utterly spoiled by adoration, it was these prattling Brookes.  Of
title: Little Women

text: course they were the most remarkable children ever born, as will be
title: Little Women

text: shown when I mention that they walked at eight months, talked fluently
title: Little Women

text: at twelve months, and at two years they took their places at table, and
title: Little Women

text: behaved with a propriety which charmed all beholders. At three, Daisy
title: Little Women

text: demanded a 'needler', and actually made a bag with four stitches in it.
title: Little Women

text: She likewise set up housekeeping in the sideboard, and managed a
title: Little Women

text: microscopic cooking stove with a skill that brought tears of pride to
title: Little Women

text: Hannah's eyes, while Demi learned his letters with his grandfather, who
title: Little Women

text: invented a new mode of teaching the alphabet by forming letters with
title: Little Women

text: his arms and legs, thus uniting gymnastics for head and heels.  The boy
title: Little Women

text: early developed a mechanical genius which delighted his father and
title: Little Women

text: distracted his mother, for he tried to imitate every machine he saw,
title: Little Women

text: and kept the nursery in a chaotic condition, with his 'sewinsheen', a
title: Little Women

text: mysterious structure of string, chairs, clothespins, and spools, for
title: Little Women

text: wheels to go 'wound and wound'.  Also a basket hung over the back of a
title: Little Women

text: chair, in which he vainly tried to hoist his too confiding sister, who,
title: Little Women

text: with feminine devotion, allowed her little head to be bumped till
title: Little Women

text: rescued, when the young inventor indignantly remarked, "Why, Marmar,
title: Little Women

text: dat's my lellywaiter, and me's trying to pull her up."
title: Little Women

text: Though utterly unlike in character, the twins got on remarkably well
title: Little Women

text: together, and seldom quarreled more than thrice a day.  Of course, Demi
title: Little Women

text: tyrannized over Daisy, and gallantly defended her from every other
title: Little Women

text: aggressor, while Daisy made a galley slave of herself, and adored her
title: Little Women

text: brother as the one perfect being in the world.  A rosy, chubby,
title: Little Women

text: sunshiny little soul was Daisy, who found her way to everybody's heart,
title: Little Women

text: and nestled there.  One of the captivating children, who seem made to
title: Little Women

text: be kissed and cuddled, adorned and adored like little goddesses, and
title: Little Women

text: produced for general approval on all festive occasions. Her small
title: Little Women

text: virtues were so sweet that she would have been quite angelic if a few
title: Little Women

text: small naughtinesses had not kept her delightfully human.  It was all
title: Little Women

text: fair weather in her world, and every morning she scrambled up to the
title: Little Women

text: window in her little nightgown to look out, and say, no matter whether
title: Little Women

text: it rained or shone, "Oh, pitty day, oh, pitty day!" Everyone was a
title: Little Women

text: friend, and she offered kisses to a stranger so confidingly that the
title: Little Women

text: most inveterate bachelor relented, and baby-lovers became faithful
title: Little Women

text: worshipers.
title: Little Women

text: "Me loves evvybody," she once said, opening her arms, with her spoon in
title: Little Women

text: one hand, and her mug in the other, as if eager to embrace and nourish
title: Little Women

text: the whole world.
title: Little Women

text: As she grew, her mother began to feel that the Dovecote would be
title: Little Women

text: blessed by the presence of an inmate as serene and loving as that which
title: Little Women

text: had helped to make the old house home, and to pray that she might be
title: Little Women

text: spared a loss like that which had lately taught them how long they had
title: Little Women

text: entertained an angel unawares.  Her grandfather often called her
title: Little Women

text: 'Beth', and her grandmother watched over her with untiring devotion, as
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: Demi, like a true Yankee, was of an inquiring turn, wanting to know
title: Little Women

text: everything, and often getting much disturbed because he could not get
title: Little Women

text: satisfactory answers to his perpetual "What for?"
title: Little Women

text: He also possessed a philosophic bent, to the great delight of his
title: Little Women

text: grandfather, who used to hold Socratic conversations with him, in which
title: Little Women

text: the precocious pupil occasionally posed his teacher, to the undisguised
title: Little Women

text: satisfaction of the womenfolk.

text: "What makes my legs go, Dranpa?" asked the young philosopher, surveying
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: head respectfully.

text: "What is a little mine?"
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: While Laurie and Amy were taking conjugal strolls over velvet carpets,
title: Little Women

text: as they set their house in order, and planned a blissful future, Mr.
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: roads and sodden fields.
title: Little Women

text: "I always do take a walk toward evening, and I don't know why I should
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: CHAPTER FORTY-SEVEN
title: Little Women

text: HARVEST TIME
title: Little Women

text: For a year Jo and her Professor worked and waited, hoped and loved, met
title: Little Women

text: occasionally, and wrote such voluminous letters that the rise in the
title: Little Women

text: price of paper was accounted for, Laurie said.  The second year began
title: Little Women

text: rather soberly, for their prospects did not brighten, and Aunt March
title: Little Women

text: died suddenly.  But when their first sorrow was over--for they loved
title: Little Women

text: the old lady in spite of her sharp tongue--they found they had cause
title: Little Women

text: for rejoicing, for she had left Plumfield to Jo, which made all sorts
title: Little Women

text: of joyful things possible.
title: Little Women

text: "It's a fine old place, and will bring a handsome sum, for of course
title: Little Women

text: you intend to sell it," said Laurie, as they were all talking the
title: Little Women

text: matter over some weeks later.
title: Little Women

text: "No, I don't," was Jo's decided answer, as she petted the fat poodle,
title: Little Women

text: whom she had adopted, out of respect to his former mistress.
title: Little Women

text: "You don't mean to live there?"
title: Little Women

text: "Yes, I do."
title: Little Women

text: "But, my dear girl, it's an immense house, and will take a power of
title: Little Women

text: money to keep it in order.  The garden and orchard alone need two or
title: Little Women

text: three men, and farming isn't in Bhaer's line, I take it."
title: Little Women

text: "He'll try his hand at it there, if I propose it."
title: Little Women

text: "And you expect to live on the produce of the place?  Well, that sounds
title: Little Women

text: paradisiacal, but you'll find it desperate hard work."
title: Little Women

text: "The crop we are going to raise is a profitable one," and Jo laughed.
title: Little Women

text: "Of what is this fine crop to consist, ma'am?"
title: Little Women

text: "Boys.  I want to open a school for little lads--a good, happy,
title: Little Women

text: homelike school, with me to take care of them and Fritz to teach them."
title: Little Women

text: "That's a truly Joian plan for you!  Isn't that just like her?" cried
title: Little Women

text: Laurie, appealing to the family, who looked as much surprised as he.
title: Little Women

text: "I like it," said Mrs. March decidedly.
title: Little Women

text: "So do I," added her husband, who welcomed the thought of a chance for
title: Little Women

text: trying the Socratic method of education on modern youth.
title: Little Women

text: "It will be an immense care for Jo," said Meg, stroking the head of her
title: Little Women

text: one all-absorbing son.
title: Little Women

text: "Jo can do it, and be happy in it.  It's a splendid idea. Tell us all
title: Little Women

text: about it," cried Mr. Laurence, who had been longing to lend the lovers
title: Little Women

text: a hand, but knew that they would refuse his help.
title: Little Women

text: "I knew you'd stand by me, sir.  Amy does too--I see it in her eyes,
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: speaks.  Now, my dear people," continued Jo earnestly, "just understand
title: Little Women

text: that this isn't a new idea of mine, but a long cherished plan.  Before
title: Little Women

text: my Fritz came, I used to think how, when I'd made my fortune, and no
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: for them, I seem to feel their wants, and sympathize with their
title: Little Women

text: troubles, and oh, I should so like to be a mother to them!"
title: Little Women

text: Mrs. March held out her hand to Jo, who took it, smiling, with tears in
title: Little Women

text: her eyes, and went on in the old enthusiastic way, which they had not
title: Little Women

text: seen for a long while.
title: Little Women

text: "I told my plan to Fritz once, and he said it was just what he would
title: Little Women

text: like, and agreed to try it when we got rich.  Bless his dear heart,
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: It's just the place for boys, the house is big, and the furniture
title: Little Women

text: strong and plain.  There's plenty of room for dozens inside, and
title: Little Women

text: splendid grounds outside. They could help in the garden and orchard.
title: Little Women

text: Such work is healthy, isn't it, sir?  Then Fritz could train and teach
title: Little Women

text: in his own way, and Father will help him.  I can feed and nurse and pet
title: Little Women

text: and scold them, and Mother will be my stand-by.  I've always longed for
title: Little Women

text: lots of boys, and never had enough, now I can fill the house full and
title: Little Women

text: revel in the little dears to my heart's content.  Think what luxury--
title: Little Women

text: Plumfield my own, and a wilderness of boys to enjoy it with me."
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women

text: There were a great many holidays at Plumfield, and one of the most
title: Little Women

title: Little Women

title: Little Women
